With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila Elizabeth can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Rahila Elizabeth spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
With God is a group of three ladies. They all live in Accra, Teshie, Ghana. They are asking for a loan of GHS 2,500 from ID-Ghana to sell cloth, sponges and gari (cassava flour). 

Tsotsoo is a 40-year-old married woman with two children. She has been selling sponges and cloth for four years. She supports her husband in taking care of the children by moving door-to-door to sell her goods. She wants to improve her business, and most of what she earns goes to family expenses. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of GHS 1,600 from ID-Ghana in order to buy more cloth and sponges to sell to customers. 

She will save part of her profit and also invest back part after she finishes repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and sponges to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, straw and buri

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 65 years old, is married and has 8 children.

Stephen likes to think of himself as a very resourceful person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Stephen plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair his home.

In total, Stephen’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of 2 children.

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income.

loans.name: Getrude's Name Group

texts.en:
Getrude, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 47 years old, a married mother of five children, and often described as a very hardworking individual.

Although Getrude has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Getrude wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Getrude hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights, as, even though Getrude decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Aiperi

texts.ru: Айпери, 24 года, замужем, есть трех годовалый сын. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, 4 года назад Айпери начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Айпери, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы и 7 коз. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айпери обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения поголовья скота. Она является одним из трех членов группы "Роза". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение и расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aiperi is 24, married, and has a three-year-old son.   She is one of three members of the group "Roza".  In search of ways to provide for her family, Aiperi started her own crop and livestock farming business 4 years ago.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has three cows and seven goats on her farm, and her net income is around 10,000 som per month.  To further develop her business, Aiperi is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy more livestock for her farm, and plans on using her extra income due to the loan to continue expanding and developing her business.

loans.use: buy additional livestock to grow her business

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en:
Alvina is a 25-year-old hardworking woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Alvina’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Alvina has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for her family's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Sokhea's Group

texts.en:
Sokhea’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokhea makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phirom's Group

texts.en: Phirom’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Phirom makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa es una mujer que se dedica al trabajo de campo quien tuvo la oportunidad de realizar sus estudios hasta la secundaria a pesar de las diferentes dificultades que sus padres en esa época enfrentaron pues para culminar sus estudios viajaba en auto bus ya que no estaba cerca la institución a la que asistía. Con el pasar de los años ella conoció a su hoy en día esposo con quien procreó tres hijos el mayor de 16 años, el segundo de 11 años y el tercero 6 años los cuales apoyan a sus padres al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles involucrándolos día con día en el trabajo de campo enseñándole al mismo tiempo el valor y sacrificio que ellos hacen para dar a cada uno lo mejor y hacerles saber lo que cuesta superarse. Por años se han dedicado a la siembra y cultivo de café lo cual aprendieron de sus padres como única fuente de empleo y de ingresos para sus familias siendo ellos quienes le heredaron un terreno para trabajar el cual está a una distancia de 10 kilómetros al cual se trasladan en carro desde hace 16 años. Sus metas y sueños poder seguir incrementando la plantación cultivada de café, la tierra para sembrar una variedad diferente y así generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. Por lo que Ana Luisa actualmente solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para poder dar a sus cultivos y su propiedad una mayor asistencia técnica hacer de la misma más productiva y provechosa esperando que los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma puedan apoyarle para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is a woman whose job is farm work and who had the opportunity to continue with her studies up to high school in spite of the the various difficulties that her parents faced back then, since in order to complete her studies she had to take a bus, and the school was far away from where she lived. With the passage of time she met her current husband with whom she has conceived three children, 16 year old eldest child, the 11 year old second child, and the 6 year old third child. All of them help their parents after school, getting involved day after day in the farm work while at the same time being taught about the values and sacrifice their parents make to give them the best, and learning what it takes to get ahead.

For years they have worked in planting and growing coffee, which they learned from their parents as a source of employment and income for their families. They inherited a piece of land from their parents that they farm on, located 10 kilometers away and they've been traveling there by car for the last 16 years. Their goals and dreams are to be able to increase the size of the coffee crop, and add more land to plant a different varietal and that way generate more income for their family's welfare. This is why Ana Luisa is currently applying for a loan to purchase supplies and pay for labor, to give the crops and the property more skilled support so that it can be more productive and fruitful, and she hopes the organization's different lenders can help her get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor to help with the coffee crop

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 41-year-old, married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She runs a vulcanizing shop. Aside from operating a shop, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling items ranging from noodles, powdered milk, soap, eggs, cooking oil and beverages. She has been in this kind of business for ten years. During her free time, Rosalinda makes and sells bibingka (rice cake). These are her sources of income. Together with her husband, they have six children. The oldest is 15, and the youngest is 3 years old.

Rosalinda is facing a financial problem, and hoping she can continue to finance her existing businesses. Rosalinda has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to by supplies for making and selling bibingka, and additional stocks for the store. With these, she can fill her store with a variety of products and sell more rice cakes.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes that she will expand her business for the welfare of her growing children and send them all to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling food, and additional stocks for her store.

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: Mamy est commerçante, présidente du groupe d’affaires «Mashauri», âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants  tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché de la ville depuis 13 ans et après, elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperies pour accroitre son activité. son conjoint est un commercant. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte scolariser, nourrir et vêtir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mamy is a trader and the president of the business group, Mashauri.  She is 37 years old, married and has ten children, who all attend school.  She has been selling second-hand clothing in the town market for thirteen years.

She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima.  Mamy plans to use her loan to buy two bales of second-hand clothing to increase her business.  Her husband is also a trader and she began her business with money provided by him.

In the future, Mamy would like to be able to educate, feed and clothe her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to small, non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 52-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of thirteen farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Margaret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Margaret described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 28 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has one child and is married. As a group leader, Judith is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Judith's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her child to school.

Judith and her group will receive a total of 9 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en: Sarwar is a 38-year-old married woman. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base. She also sells shoes to generate extra income. Currently, Sarwar has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to  boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes  principios, se dedica a realizar trabajos de agricultura y albañilería, también se dedica a la ganadería, es una actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos. Se creció con sus abuelos quienes le formaron y le inculcaron buenos valores y principios morales los que lo han llevado a ser una persona muy educada y reconocida en su comunidad.

José aprendió los trabajos de construcción de un tío que vivía con sus abuelos mientras él se crecía, de esta manera adquirió experiencia y hoy en día  se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos a parte de la ganadería le sirve para llevar el sustento diario a su familia, la cual está formada por su esposa y su hijo que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

José se dedica a la agricultura y  albañilería desde la edad de 20 años, por las ganancias que le genera ha decidido continuar ejerciendo estas actividades ya que se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia pues ella se dedica a administrar una tienda que es de su propiedad, de esta forma juntos pueden satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y solventar con las obligaciones financieras.


El dinero será utilizado para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, sal, harina, huevos, etc.  para la venta ya que poseen una tienda y la clientela le demanda comprar más productos, ya que por vivir en una zona muy poblada su negocio está siendo muy rentable. De esta forma, obtendrá un mejor ingreso lo cual le servirá para dar educación a sus hijos y realizar mejoras en su casa.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son las de tener una tienda más amplia y surtida,  también otra de las proyecciones que tiene a futuro son las de comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladarse y trasladar material  de albañilería hacia su lugar de trabajo, también apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las instalaciones donde reposa el ganado.
texts.en:
Jose, 46 years old, is a person with excellent principles. He is dedicated to working in agriculture and masonry.  He also raises cattle.  It is an activity that he learned from his grandparents. He grew up with his grandparents who formed and instilled in him good values and moral principles which have led him to be a very educated and respected person in his community.

Jose learned the construction trade from an uncle who lived with his grandparents while he was growing up.  He thus gained experience and today it is the main source of income along with raising livestock which serves to bring the daily bread for his family.  His family consists of his wife and his son who is studying in the school in their community.

Jose has been working in agriculture and masonry from the age of 20 years.  With the profits that were generated, he has decided to continue these activities as they have become their main source of income.  His wife also makes an economic contribution to their family because she is dedicated to managing a store that that they own.  Together they can meet the needs of their home and pay their financial obligations.

The money will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, salt, flour, eggs, etc. for re-sale.  They have a store and customers are asking to buy more products.  Because they live in a densely populated area, their business is very profitable. This way, they will get a better income which will serve to educate their child and make improvements to their home.

The goals they have for the future are to have a broader and more well-stocked shop.  Another of the projections for the future are buying a vehicle for transportation and to move masonry materials to his workplace.  Also, the profits will support the education of their child and improve the facilities where they keep the cattle.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, salt, flour, eggs, etc. for re-sale because they have a store and customers are asking to buy more products.

loans.name: Atiya

texts.en:
Atiya is 40 years old. She is a married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. 

She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

She has 2 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income for providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income for providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Solomon joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Promise, Mericle and Ruth.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Solomon would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Solomon can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Solomon spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: Sinuon’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sinuon makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor, village coordinator, construction worker and by buying and selling groceries from home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 12 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Victor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Victor, age 48, lives in his own home with his mother. He has been in the business of making clothing for twelve years now, a business which he runs out of his home. He has many customers thanks to the quality of his clothing items. Victor is requesting this loan so that he can buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics, and more This will help him continue his work, which earns him good money.

loans.use: supply his tailoring business

loans.name: Nieves Alfredo

texts.es:
Nieves de 49 años de edad,  se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería por contratos, también se dedica a trabajar la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos. Se creció con sus padres quienes le formaron y le inculcaron buenos principios los que lo han convertido en una persona muy educada y reconocida en su comunidad.

Nieves aprendió los trabajos de construcción de su padre, de esta manera adquirió experiencia y hoy en día  se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de la cual le sirve para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y también cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

Su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia,  pues ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas los fines de semana; de esta manera apoya a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arena, cemento, grava, para construir en la parte exterior de su casa unas habitaciones, para luego ser rentados a personas que viajan y maestros que laboran en el centro escolar. De esta manera, tendrá un mejor ingreso ya que mensualmente espera recibir $90.00 lo que le ayudara a solventar sus compromisos crediticios. 

Las metas que tiene a futuro son las tener una vivienda más preparada y amueblada, adquirir un nuevo préstamo para la compra de un vehículo, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos ya que uno de ellos sueña con ser veterinario.
texts.en:
Nieves is 49 years old and works as an independent contractor in masonry, and also does farm work planting staple foods. He grew up with his parents who raised him and taught him the principles that have made him a polite, well-regarded person in his community.

Nieves learned construction work from his father, and thus gained experience in the trade that is now the primary source of income that he uses to put food on his family's table and also pay his financial commitments.

His wife contributes financially to the family, by selling pupusas on the weekends; this is how she helps provide the household necessities.

The loan he's applying for from CREDICAMPO is to purchase sand, cement, and gravel to build some rooms in the outer part of his house to subsequently rent to travelers and teachers that work at the educational center. This way, he'll have more income since he figures on collecting $90.00 monthly, which will help pay off his loans.

His goals in the future are to have a house that's fixed-up and better furnished, to obtain a new loan to purchase a vehicle, and to help his kids with their studies since one of them dreams of becoming a veterinarian.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, and gravel to build some rooms in the outer part of his home that he can then rent to travelers and teachers.

loans.name: Taalaibek

texts.ru: Таалайбек, 47 лет, женат, отец 3 детей. У Таалайбека среднее образование, он очень жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый. В качестве основного дохода Таалайбек на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Таалайбека, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 коровы. Также есть 5,0 ГА поливной земли, где Таалайбек выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль в хороший сезон составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Таалайбек реализует молоко, которое пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Таалайбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни его семьи и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Taalaibek is 47, married, and a father of three children.  He has the equivalent of a high school education, and is very cheerful and hardworking.  For 20 years, Taalaibek has been a crop and livestock farmer.  Thanks to his persistent efforts, he currently has two cows and 5.0 hectares of irrigated land for growing clover as a cash crop as well as for use on his farm.  His monthly net income in a good season is up to 15,000 som.  Taalaibek sells milk, which there's a lot of demand for among the locals in his area.  To further develop his business, he's seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy some cows.  He plans on using his extra income due to the loan to add even more animals to his farm, which will help increase his family's quality of life and allow him to renovate his home.

loans.use: buy additional cows

loans.name: Junilda

texts.en:
Junilda is a 36-year-old mother of two children, who are six and sixteen years old. She and her family live in Baybay, Leyte. 

Her husband works in a school post office while Junilda buys and sells frozen meat products like hot dogs and Spanish sausages. This usually earns her 1,300 PHP per week. 

Junilda is requesting for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stock of hot dogs and sausages. 

Her income helps provide her family with food and household bills. 

Junilda is optimistic about the future of her business. She is determined to improve it and to create a better customer base for better profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hot dogs and sausages

loans.name: Canaana Group

texts.fr: Kavira est une brave commerçante, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, présidente de la banque villageoise «Canaana», âgée de 50 ans, mariée à un chauffeur et mère de 10 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des  boissons depuis 30 ans. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 caisses de sucrés et 5 de Primus. Ainsi, elle compte augmenter le capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kavira is a courageous trader and client of the field partner, Hekima.  She is the president of the 'Banque Villageoise' Canaana. 

Kavira is 50 years old, married to a driver, and mother to ten children who all attend school.  She has been selling drinks for thirty years now.  She sells her products from her home on a busy avenue of her town.  Her business was started with funds provided by her husband.

This new loan will be used to buy five crates of soft drinks and five crates of Primus beer.  This will allow her to improve her working capital levels, and educate and feed her children.

Kavira is very grateful to Hekima for the independence they offer to small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 5 crates of soft drinks and 5 crates of Primus beer for resale.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Baybay, Leyte. She is 38 years old and married with two children, ages 10 and 14. Her husband works as a driver. For a year now, her sari-sari store business has been thriving, and she is hoping to expand it. 

Rose Marie is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy noodles, seasonings, canned goods, toiletries and snack food. 

Any income generated from her business will be used for tuition fees, healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, seasonings, canned goods, toiletries and snack food

loans.name: Garba Lauya

texts.en: Garba Lauya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Garba Lauya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Jamilu, Wasila and Islam. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba Lauya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba Lauya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Garba Lauya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 31-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Margret is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Zahida is popularly known in her area for her skill in sewing. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Naiim

texts.en:
Naiim is a 36-year-old married father of two. He is a Syrian citizen who started his own furniture making business in Lebanon in December 2012, to provide his family with better standards of living.

He has 14 years of experience in this domain, since his ancestors started it and he found himself born to do it, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can.

Today, Naiim is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to register a new car he bought for his business development, which he will use to transport finished furniture and business tools freely.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his business as much as he can to make sure he can provide his beloved family a brighter future.

loans.use: to register a new car he bought for his business, which he will use to transport finished furniture and business tools freely

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is an industrious mother residing in Dulag, Leyte. She engages in a retail business, selling T-shirts, blankets, bags, towels, and other items.  

She is 47 years old and has four children. Her oldest child is 25, and the youngest is 5. To be able to augment her income, Evelyn also engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish. During her free time, she also engages in buying and selling snack food to help augment her income.

Evelyn has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy assorted food and fishing materials like fishing net. These are essential tools in making her earnings improve and hopefully increases her catch.

In the future, Evelyn would like to expand her business to be successful and hopefully continue to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted food and fishing materials like fishing net

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
María de 28 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la ganadería, ella se creció con su abuela quien se dedicaba a la ganadería y  oficios domésticos, ella es una mujer muy educada y trabajadora. 

Su abuela fue la encargada de inculcar principios morales y son los que la han llevado a salir adelante en la vida, ella es una mujer muy reconocida por sus actividades productivas también por pertenecer a la asociación de desarrollo comunal.

María tiene una experiencia de 15 años en realizar trabajos de ganadería,  una actividad que aprendió de su abuela quien se dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad y fue quien le inculco buenas ideas y principios para poder salir adelante.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar concentrado para el ganado, ya que recién se entra en época de verano y es necesario que prepare de alimento para el transcurso del año. También otra parta del dinero será utilizado en preparación de pastizales para el ganado. 


Las metas que tiene para un futuro son las de haber cancelado el crédito y adquirir otro para el mejoramiento de las instalaciones donde reposa el ganado, también pretende invertir en una picadora de zacate para dar alimento fresco a los animales.
texts.en:
Maria, 28 years old, is dedicated to domestic chores and livestock. She grew up with her grandmother who was devoted to livestock and domestic chores. Maria is a very polite and hardworking woman.

Her grandmother was responsible for instilling in her moral principles which she has carried with her throughout life.  She is a woman well known for her productive activities as well as belonging to the association for community development.

Maria has 15 years of experience working with livestock. This is an activity she learned from her grandmother who worked all her life and who taught good ideas and principles to succeed.

The loan she is requesting is to buy concentrate for livestock because they are entering the summer season and it is necessary to prepare feed to get through the year.  A portion of the money will also be used in preparation of pastures for livestock.

The goals she has for the future are to pay back the loan and obtain another for the improvement of facilities where the cattle are kept.  She also plans to invest in a shredder to give fresh grass fed to animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock for when one enters the summer season and also to prepare pasture for livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a laptop to be admitted into the air force academy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cosmetics to supply her business

loans.name: Zakaria's Group

texts.en:
Zakaria is 70 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Zakaria has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Zakaria also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Zakaria's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Jane is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 14 farmers in the Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jane started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Jane’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of eight acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Qazim

texts.en: Qazim is 34 years old and recently married. He has no children yet. In order to earn a living he is involved in agricultural work, selling milk and milk products, planting corn and wheat on his land to use and sell, and also has a flour mill. He used to have a cow, but because of difficult financial times he was forced to sell it for some quick income. Now, he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase another cow to start selling the milk and dairy products again in the neighborhood. He already has a contract and agreement to sell milk in his neighborhood, so he knows that he will be successful. He is very happy for the opportunity to be able to continue with his dairy sales and is hoping in the future he can expand his farm even more, owning many cows.

loans.use: To purchase another cow to start selling the milk and dairy products again in the neighborhood

loans.name: Adom Firi Nyame Group

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 57-year-old farmer who comes from Egyirkrom in the Central Region of Ghana. He has an orange farm on a 12-acre piece of farmland. Benjamin is married with 4 children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old and the youngest of whom is 4 years old. All the children are in school. 

Benjamin has been farming for the past 30 years and has gained much experience in farming. He supports his family from the income of his farm. It has become difficult for Benjamin to maintain his farm alone due to the large size of the farm. 

Benjamin needs a working capital loan to undertake timely farm maintenance to maximise fruit flowering and the harvest.  He is requesting financial assistance to pay for organised hired labour. Benjamin also needs money to buy fertilizer to improve crop yield. 

He has plans of using the income from the farm to expand it further and pay for the children's school fees.  Benjamin thanks all his microlenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To hire labour to weed the farm, and also to buy fertilizer and fly traps

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna, her husband and two little kids live in Syuniq region, Khndzoresk village. 

Since Syuzanna got married she has been running their family farm. Specifically, she keeps livestock of cows, calves, pigs and piglets. Syuzanna uses the milk in cheese production as well as in some other dairy product production. Due to her tireless work, the farm is in very good condition.

In order to add two cows to her livestock and enlarge the production of dairy products, Syuzanna has applied for this loan. She hopes for lenders' support  to her loan and ensures stable and on time payments.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock in winter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her market gardening activity.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 50-year-old married woman. She runs a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas, and Mumtaz ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. They also sell animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Mumtaz has requested 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, and to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, and to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Hamida expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: María Entima

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y al servicio a los demás, ella se creció con su abuela fue ella la responsable de apoyar e inculcar buenos valores a la joven en aquella época. María puso en práctica aquellos valores y principios y fue ello lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante, en la vida ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y pupusas los días de semana por la tarde, es una señora muy dedicada al servicio de los demás también ella forma parte de la asociación de desarrollo comunal de su comunidad. Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a los trabajos comunitarios.

María se dedica a la venta de pupusas y todos los días por las tardes, también vende tamales de gallina los fines de semana, esta actividad la aprendió de su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a la venta de pupusas en el pueblo, a esta actividad se suma la ayuda de una de sus nietas quien le ayuda todos los días a las ventas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una plancha nueva para la venta de pupusas ya que se acerca la época de fin de año y manifiesta que las ventas para esta temporada le demandan que sus equipos de trabajo estén en óptimas condiciones para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.


Las proyecciones que la señora tiene para un futuro son las de establecer su negocio más formal, ya que planea construir instalaciones más adecuadas para trabajar todos los días ya que aparte de las pupusas también planea dedicarse a la venta de desayunos,  almuerzos y cenas y todo esto lo va lograr con la eficiente administración del crédito y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, age 61, is dedicated to both her work and to serving others. She grew up with her grandmother, who supported her and taught the then-child good values. María put those values and principles into practice, and they have been what helped her to get ahead. María is in the business of selling tamales and pupusas (a typical meat- or cheese-stuffed dumpling) in the afternoons. She's devoted to serving others and she is also part of a local community development association. She's responsible and dedicated to community service.

María sells pupusas every afternoon and she also sells chicken tamales on weekends. She learned the work from her grandmother, who sold pupusas in the village her entire life. She is helped by her own granddaughter, who is there every day to help her with her sales.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for buying a new grill to make the pupusas on. The end of the year is approaching and the demand in that season means that the tools of her job have to be in optimal working condition in order for her to be able to serve her customers.

María's plans for the future include establishing a more formal business. She is already planning to build facilities that are more adequate for her daily work. Also, in addition to pupusas, she plans to sell breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. She will do all this through the efficient administration of loans and her income.

loans.use: buy a new grill for making and selling pupusas

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a mother of four grown children, residing in Dulag, Leyte. She is sixty-one years old and very active in raising and selling hogs. She has been raising hogs for more than fifteen years now. Aside from the hog raising business, she sells root crops for additional income.
 
Fe has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy an additional pig and to purchase more root crops like sweet potato, taro, and peanuts. This will create higher earnings and eventually lead to the sale of more pigs. With this, she could afford a healthy diet, which is very essential in day-to-day living.

She is hoping that someday she will successfully manage both of her businesses to live better and set aside some savings to prepare for the coming of old age.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig and to purchase more root crops like sweet potato, taro, and peanuts

loans.name: Cuyauris De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUYAIRIS DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, servicio de transporte, venta de muebles, venta de carne de cordero, taller mecánico, servicio de construcción, tejido de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de muebles y enseres; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar el alto comercio de estos productos en el mercado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group, "CUYAIRIS DE SAN ROQUE", are starting their fourth round in Pro Mujer, as part of the Downtown Los Andes.  The group is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Virginia is the President.  Members of this community association are involved in a number of business.  Among them are: selling blankets, transportation, furniture for sale, selling lamb, mechanical shop, construction service, and weaving fabric.

The loan requested is to benefit micro-entrepreneurs where Virginia is a member.  She says that it is the third year that she has been a part of  Pro Mujer.  She joined as a result of an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.  Today she has a business selling furniture and fixtures.  She says that she started this business after observing the high volume of trade in these products in the market.

The loan she is requesting is for an increase in capital (to buy fabric from wholesalers selling in the City of La Paz) and subsequently obtaining a stall in the market. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially.  She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her husband and her children.

loans.name: Doris Angelica

texts.es: Doña Doris tiene 55 años de edad una mujer muy humilde pero muy trabajadora la que por años se ha dedicado a la siembra y cultivo de café siendo este rubro por años la principal fuente de ingresos económicos para la superación de su familia y de sus hijos. Ella realizó únicamente el primer grado ya que sus padres no pudieron brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar por la falta de recursos económicos. Ella es casada tuvo tres hijos de su matrimonio su hija mayor de 25 años, su segunda hija tiene 20 años y su última y tercera hija tiene 19 años. Con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo les han brindado lo mejor dentro de la posible para que puedan estudiar y superarse en cada una de sus vidas. El terreno que juntos trabajan fue herencia de sus padres el cual trabajan desde hace 30 años aproximadamente teniendo una gran experiencia en dicha actividad el cual está ubicado a 100 metros de distancia desde su casa de habitacion al cual se trasladan fácilmente caminando y al cual le dan un mantenimiento adecuado y constante. Su sueño y meta que su cultivo de café sea una de la más productivas en la zona generando de esa manera mayor credibilidad y economía para el mantenimiento del hogar y de su propiedad la cual sea auto sostenible para salir adelante. Por lo cual ella solicita en esta ocasión sea apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para poder comprar los diferentes insumos que serán de gran utilidad en el desarrollo, cuidado y protección de la planta y del grano en esta temporada al igual que poder pagar mano de obra calificada para hacer un mejor uso de los insumos y dar a su propiedad una mayor y mejor asistencia
texts.en:
Doris, age 55, is a humble but hard-working woman. For years she has been in the business of planting and growing coffee, and this work has been the main source of income and improvement for her and her family for years. She only completed the first grade since her parents didn't have enough money to keep her in school. Doris is married and she has three children: her oldest daughter is 25 years old, her second daughter is 20 and her youngest daughter is 19. With a lot of hard work, she and her husband gave them the best possible opportunities so that they could stay in school and make the most of themselves in life. 

The land that they work was inherited from their parents; they have thirty years of experience working the land. The plot is located just 100 meters from their home, making it easy to walk there and easy to give it the constant attention it needs. Her goal for her coffee crop is that it become one of the mot productive in the area, generating enough credibility and income to sustain their household and properties, which will become self sufficient going forward.

In order to do this, she is requesting support from Kiva investors which she will use to buy the necessary supplies to develop, care for, and protect the plants and the beans for the season as well as to pay for qualified labor that will make the best use of her supplies and give her property both more and better help.

loans.use: pay for supplies and labor to grow her coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footware to sell.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter de 39 años de edad viven casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes escolares en su microbus desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Walter, age 39, lives with his wife in their own home. He has six years of experience in the business of making school trips in his microbus. He has many established customers who prefer him for his responsible driving practices. With what he earns from this work, he is able to cover their household expenses. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of tires and the costs of a routine vehicle maintenance. His vehicle is his only source of work and it enables him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy tires and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en: Nazmi is 37 years old and the father of 2 children. He is a cook and works a lot in order to offer his children whatever they need. Although he works in a local restaurant, he earns a low salary. His wife is a seamstress, working hard in order to supplement their income. Nazmi also works as a caterer, cooking and serving food for people at their events such as weddings and other celebrations. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a grill oven that he can use for his catering business. This loan will help him to be able to provide better and more food, and to serve larger gatherings, thereby increasing his income. He wants to thank the lenders for their support and appreciates all of the help.

loans.use: to purchase a grill oven that he can use for his catering business.

loans.name: Istiphanus

texts.en: Istiphanus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Istiphanus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Vicent and Friday. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Istiphanus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cover his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Istiphanus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Istiphanus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and to eventually become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her market gardening activity.

loans.name: José Benjamín

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vive con su familia que está formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos. Él se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos. Su familia estaba formada por sus padres y sus 3 hermanos todos aportaban a la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia, con el paso del tiempo decidió independizarse y formo su familia. Su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos, juntos son padres de dos hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en  la escuela de su comunidad.

José tiene una experiencia de 29 años en los trabajos de agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor, y es lo que lo ha llevado ser una persona de éxito en su vida y ser un ejemplo para sus hijos.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar el alquiler de una máquina y personas que le ayudaran a recoger las cosechas de maíz, de esta manera podrá tener sus cosechas seguras y en poco tiempo listas para la venta.


Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, pagar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo para comenzar a cultivar hortalizas, ya que cuenta con un terreno que es bien adecuado para el trabajo de las hortalizas.
texts.en:
José, age 39, is a farmer and rancher. He lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and their two children. He grew up with his parents, who also farmed for their primary source of income. His parents and their three children all worked to meet the needs of the family. As he grew up, he decided to be indepedent and start his own family. His wife runs the household, and together they are the parents of two children who study at a local school.

José has 29 years of experience in farming, work which he learned from his parents who raised and taught him with love. They are the reason he has become a successful person in life and an example to his children.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to pay for the rental of a machine and for people who will help him to harvest his corn. That way he'll have a secure harvest that will be ready for sale in less time.

His plans for the future are to support the education of his children, pay off this loan, and request another to begin growing vegetables, as he now has a plot of land that is well suited for the purpose.

loans.use: rent a machine and hire people to help him harvest his corn

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a 48-year-old proud father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 7 farmers in the Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Moses has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Moses described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, Moses’ Group will be able to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hylkije

texts.en:
Hylkije is 37 years old and single. She lives with her entire family. Her brother and her are the main sources of income for the family. 

For more than 12 years, Hylkije has been running her own business selling traditional clothing. She has managed to open two shops during this time and has seen much success. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing for the shops. Hylkije is planning to hire her mother to help with sales and daily business in her shop.

In the future, Hylkije hopes to get married. She is saving money for that day.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her shop

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 38 year old married.  He has two children. Zaur works in agriculture, farming food.  He sells his crops in the central bazaar, but his salary is not enough to cover family needs. The main hardship that Zaur faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine and water trap. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a high quality water trap.

Zaur hopes for his  family to be healthy and happy, for his  business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his  kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a high quality water trap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her market gardening activity.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, age 40, lives in her own home with her partner. Three years ago, she got into the business of growing corn. When her harvest is ready, she will sell it in nearby villages; she already has many loyal customers. Maria is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides and more as well as to improve the land shown in the photo. This will help her keep farming, which is her sole work, and earn more money.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to improve her land

loans.name: Dorica's Group

texts.en:
Dorica is a 55-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in the Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Dorica has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Dorica described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Dorica’s Group will be able to plant a total of six acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Granit

texts.en: Granit wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous support and loan he received. He was able to use the loan to renovate his home, complete the facade and the flooring. His living conditions have greatly improved now and he is looking forward to having a very comfortable and healthy environment for his family this upcoming winter season. He also looks forward to saving on the costs of heating his home. Now, he is planning to start a business with his father and brother, selling grilled and baked chickens from a kiosk that they already have. He is in need of a loan in order to prepare the small kiosk and purchase the chickens. He is very grateful for the continued support and opportunities given by the lenders.

loans.use: to prepare a small food kiosk and purchase chickens to cook and sell.

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.en:
Mahmuda is a maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mahmuda would sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mahmuda can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Mahmuda is looking to earn a higher income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices during the harvest

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en: John is a forty-six year old Komaza tree farmer. He has seven children, all of whom are in school. John is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, John also cultivates subsistence crops and supports his family with farming. He decided to join Komaza because the sale of the trees will make money for his children. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees for his children and expand his business. John’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the the trainings that are offered to the farmers by the field staff. John is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DEL SOL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de cerveza, servicio de lavado de autos, venta de mantas, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelly es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la carencia y la necesidad de este comercio en su zona, mismo que requerían sus vecinos y su persona. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "Luz del Sol" ("Sunlight") will be starting its first term with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Villa Exaltación. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors headed by Nelly, the president. Its members run a wide variety of businesses including general stores, food sales, beer sales, car-washing services, blanket sales, and snack sales.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesses in Nelly's group. She said that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the group. She currently runs a neighborhood general store. She said that she started the business upon observing that there was both a lack and a need for this kind of business in her area, the type that she and her neighbors would use.

This loan will be used to expand her capital by buying inventory at wholesale, which she will get from sellers in the city of La Paz and then later sell in her own space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as she is the single mother of one child.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training and the health consultation that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy inventory at wholesale

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called Promise, and they are four in number. On average, they are 45 years old, and have three children each. They all live in the Teshie neighborhood, in Accra-Ghana. They are friends or neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities at Teshie. They are involved in small retail, and sell maize, waakye (cooked rice and beans), African wax-prints, bags, slippons and enamel bowls. In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join ID-Ghana. This is their tenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. 
Gifty, the featured borrower, is a well-known cereal, waakye (cook rice and beans) seller. In the photo, she is standing at far right in the photo. She is planning to use her loan to buy maize in bulk from the market.  She will also buy rice and beans to prepare waakye and sell to customers. Most of her customers are in Teshie. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her children.
They have good repayment records and will hold each other responsible for the repayment of this loan.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk from the market and also to buy rice and beans to prepare waakye and sell to customers.

loans.name: Mansab

texts.en: Mansab is a 39-year-old married woman. She has had a business selling cloth for a period of about two years. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Mansab has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lindar's Group

texts.en:
"Lindar is 22 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. She has two children and is married. As a group leader, Lindar is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Lindar's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Lindar and her group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Divinas Fortalezas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIVINAS FORTALEZAS II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vatidos, costura de chamarras, servicio de internet, taller de carpintería, venta de faldas y mantillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tejido de mantas y polainas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar en el mercado el amplio comercio de este producto, es por ello que decide emprenderlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la forma de trabajar que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Divinas Fortalezas II" ("Women of Divine Strength") will begin its second term with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office Los Andes. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors headed by Cristina, the president. The members of the group run a wide variety of businesses, including selling smoothies, sewing jackets, providing internet services, running a carpentry shop, and selling skirts and shawls.

The loan will benefit all of the entrepreneurs in Cristina's group. She said that this is her third year in Pro Mujer and she joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the group. She currently runs a business selling shawls and traditional skirts. She said that she got into the business when she saw that this type of product was selling really well in the markets, so she decided to give it a try.

The loan that she is requesting now will be used to increase her capital by purchasing wool at wholesale. She will buy it from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and then after making her products, sell them in her own sales stall. This work helps her support her family; she is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer she said that she likes the kind of work that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy wool at wholesale

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Annah, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Annah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce her household's consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Annah plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Annah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 18 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a farmer in Tala town and has been in the farming business for the past six years. She is 36 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farming. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has successfully paid her previous loan. In future she hopes to expand her business and live a better life together with her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nizoramoh

texts.ru: Низорамох простая сельская женщина, которой 33 года. Она из села района Кубадиён. Низорамох замужем за водителя такси и у них есть несовершеннолетние дети. Низорамох домохозяйка и сейчас хотела бы начать собственный бизнес, чтобы улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она заинтересована в животноводческой деятельности, а именно в разведении мелкорогатых скотин. Ее начальный капитал составляет 100 долларов. Низорамох на сумму собственного сбережения и запрашиваемого кредита собирается приобрести 4 голов овец и корм для них. Только с вашей поддержки она сможет реализовать свои планы и начать бизнес. Поэтому она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Nizoramoh is a common village woman, who is 33 years old. She is from a village in the Qubadiyon region. Nizoramoh is married to a taxi driver and they have underage children. 

Nizoramoh is a housewife, and currently she would like to start her own business, in order to improve the family's living conditions. She is interested in livestock breeding, specifically in breeding sheep and goats. Her start-up capital is 100 US dollar. 

With her own savings and the loan requested, Nizoramoh has decided to purchase four sheep and fodder for them. Only with your support will she be able to realize her plans and start the business. Therefore she hopes very much for your support.

loans.use: to purchase four sheep and fodder for them, in order to start a business and support her family

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her market gardening activity.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
With the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva, Shazia has successfully built her business selling milk. She has a good number of customers and makes a nice income to contribute to her family. In addition to selling milk, Shazia also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income.  

Previously, Shazia was able to expand her business with Kiva's help. Now she is in her sixth loan cycle and is applying for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. Having an extra cow will enable Shazia to increase her milk sales, sell to more cities, and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Shemsije

texts.en:
