Shemsje is a very hardworking woman who does much in order to earn a living and help support her family. She is 38 years old and has two children. Her husband owns a private construction company and she has a greenhouse, where she plants different vegetables for her family to use and to sell. 

For the first time she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new machine for her husband's line of work. She hopes that this will help him to be able to work more efficiently and produce better quality work for his customers, securing more income and better living conditions for their family. She is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en: Tanzeela  is a 33 year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Tanzeela  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Sheela

texts.en: Sheela  is a 58 year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Sheela ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sheela  has requested for 40,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Festo's Group

texts.en:
"Festo is a 66-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Festo has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Festo described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Festo’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en: Ruqiya  is a 26 year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Amanecer De Huayhuasi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER DE HUAYHUASI” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por trece  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de guantes y gorros, tejido, tienda de barrio, producción de papa, taller de imprenta, servicio de transporte.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de guantes y gorras; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido para exportación. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amanecer de Huayhuasi" is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is made up of thirteen members and led up by a board of directors. Cristina is the secretary.

The members have a variety of businesses, including: hand-knitted gloves and hats, neighborhood store, potato farming, print shop, and transport services. 

This loan will benefit women owners of micro-enterprises, Cristina being one of them. She states that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, at the invitation of an adviser from the institution who paid her a visit at her domicile. 

At present, she has a business hand-knitting and selling gloves and hats. She shares that she learned this business from her parents, since as a child she helped in the family business. Now with a family of her own, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that Cristina is taking now is to stock up on supplies (wholesale purchase of wool), which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in La Paz. She will then make her products on request for export sales.

This type of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, since she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Cristina answered that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Expresso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EXPRESSO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Massiel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de bisutería, venta de repuestos de celulares, venta de chompas, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de overoles, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Massiel es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, ya que ella necesitaba generar recursos para poder establecer su familia, es por ello que ella emprende este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pollos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene  dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The EXPRESSO communal bank will start its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación focus group, which is comprised of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Massiel is the President. The members’ businesses are varied, including jewelry sales, cell phone part sales, sweater sales, cosmetic sales, a neighborhood store, overall sales, and food sales.

The loan they’re taking out will benefit small businesses. Massiel, who is a member, said that she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago after she was invited by a friend who was a client of the institution. She currently has a store where she sells food. She says that she learned this business from her mother several years ago. Because she needed to earn money to stabilize her family, she decided to open this business.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy chickens wholesale. She will get them from vendors in La Paz and then she’ll prepare them and sell them by customer order. This form of work allows her to earn income to financially support her family since she is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the medical consultations that they offer.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Дилбару 52 года. Она проживает в городе Душанбе. Она разведена с мужем и живет вместе с сыном, его женой и двумя внуками. Дилбар также имеет двоих дочерей. Ее сын работает в одном из кафе-баров города барменом. Дилбар более 10 лет своей жизни посвятила швейной деятельности. Она берет заказы на шитье женских платьев и занимается обучением женщин и девушек правильно шить. 
  Дилбар решила освоить для себя новое ремесло-вышивка. Это и есть цель ее кредитования. Она хочет купить вышивальную машинку. Дилбар надеется быстро освоить новую работу и сможет также предоставлять услугу вышивальщицы.
texts.en:
Dilbar is 52 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is divorced from her husband and lives together with her son, his wife and her two grandchildren. Dilbar also has two daughters. Her son works as a bartender at one of cafés in the city. 

Dilbar has dedicated more than 10 years of her life to sewing. She takes order for sewing women's dresses and also trains women and girls how to sew. 

Dilbar decided to learn a new skill - embroidery. This is also the goal of her taking a loan. She would like to purchase an embroidery machine. Dilbar hopes to learn the new work quickly and be able to also provide an embroidery service.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.ru: Курбонби 46-летняя жительница района Вахш. Она портниха и занимается швейным делом на протяжении 7 лет. Курбонби живет с мужем, дочерью, тремя сыновьями и невесткой. Ее муж вместе со старшим сыном находится в России на заработках. Сама Курбонби вместе с дочерью принимает заказы на пошив женских платьев у себя дома. А двое ее младших сыновей еще учатся. Один ее сын студент и Курбонби еще не оплатила за его годовое обучение в ВУЗе. Так как у нее сейчас имеются трудности с финансами, она решила получить кредит. Курбонби просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США. Из этой суммы 1660 долларов пойдут на оплату контракта ВУЗа, а 340 долларов для купли ноутбука для учебы сына. Этот кредит очень важен семье Курбонби. Они надеются на финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Qurbonbi is a 46 years old resident of the Vakhsh region. She is a seamstress and has worked with sewing for a period of seven years. Qurbonbi lives with her husband, daughter, three sons and a daughter-in-law. Her husband and her eldest son are in Russia as migrant workers. 

Qurbonbi and her daughter take orders for sewing women's dresses at their house. The two younger sons are still in school. One is a student and Qurbonbi has still not paid for his university education this year. As she currently has difficulties with her finances, she decided to take a loan. 

Qurbonbi requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar. From this, 1,660 dollar will go to paying the tuition fee, and 340 dollar to purchase a laptop for her son. This loan is very important for Qurbonbi's family. They hope for financial help.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee, and also to purchase a laptop for her son's education

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la peca artesanal, comercializa el pescado en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ya tiene clientes establecidos por los buenos precios, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmallos para continuar con la pesca y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, has made a living for several years as an artisanal fisher. She sells the fish in different markets that are near her home. She already has established customers due to her good prices. Maria lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.

She is requesting this loan to buy fishing nets to keep fishing and to earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a calf in order to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Exnas

texts.en: Exnas is a 34-year-old, married woman. She deals in a business selling dry fruits in her locality to earn an income. In this way, she is better able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively. She is contentedly operating her business for the sake of her family, who appreciates and shows respect for her efforts. Due to a lack of availability of funds, Exnas is currently unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase peanuts, walnuts, and almonds. This investment will help her to inflate her sales. Exnas dreams of providing a good lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, walnuts, and almonds.

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en:
Shahmeem is a 45-year-old married woman. She successfully runs a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their two children. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 34-year-old, married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Abida makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Abida wishes to utilize part of her revenue on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Inusa, Shu and Aibu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 36 años de edad culmino en su juventud su primer nivel educativo como lo es la primaria con muchas dificultades y demás interferencias en el camino sus padres a pesar de los pocos ingresos económicos le apoyaron para que ella pudiese aprender lo básico por los momentos leer y escribir. Ella es casada decisión que tomo a temprana edad teniendo una edad de 15 años cuando dio ese paso del cual procreo junto hasta hoy en día su esposo dos hijos la mayor de trece años y su hijo menor tiene seis años a los cuales con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio proveen los necesario para que a ellos no les falta nada y puedan ser mejores cada día empezando por sus estudios los cuales ven con mayores oportunidades de realizar en esta época que en la que ella tuvo en su juventud pues las opciones son mayores y las facilidades son mayores realizando un pequeño esfuerzo. La decisión junto a su esposo de dedicarse a la siembra y cultivo de café fue tomada por ambas partes pues esta es rentable siempre y cuando la planta y la tierra este bien asistida y cuidada. Fueron sus suegros quienes les heredaron un pedazo de tierra para que pudiesen trabajar el cual está ubicado a dos kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitacion al cual se trasladan caminando para dar la asistencia, cuidado y demás que sus plantaciones necesitan para ser productoras y auto sostenibles siendo su único desafío el incremento en los precios de los insumos y el acarreo del mismo. Por lo que en esta ocasión ella solicita apoyo financiero para poder comprar los mismos y pagar la mano de obra para asistir la plantación al igual que el acarreo del mismo. Su sueño como madre es seguir invirtiendo en los estudios de sus hijos, apoyarles en lo mayormente posible para que puedan superase y ser mejores, para con su propiedad y negocio seguir ampliándolo aún más y dejar a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio mayormente fortalecido y que sigan con la actividad de la familia.
texts.en:
Irma, now age 36, managed to complete primary school as a child. It wasn't easy, but despite the many difficulties and interferences in her path and their limited economic resources, her parents were able to keep her in school long enough to learn basic reading and writing.

She married at just fifteen years of age, and today she and her husband have two children: the older is thirteen years old and their younger child is six. With a great deal of hard work and sacrifice, she and her husband are ensuring that their children want for nothing and have the opportunity to get better every day. A big part of that is their education as Irma strives to ensure that her children have more opportunities than she herself had as a child.

She and her husband made the decision together to plant and raise coffee because it's a profitable crop whenever the plant and the land are well tended and cared for. They inherited their land from her in-laws, and it is located about two kilometers from their home. They are able to walk that distance to provide it with the care and attention that it needs to be productive and self sustaining. Their only challenge is the increasing prices for supplies and transporting them. This challenge is why Irma is seeking financial support to be able to buy and transport both supplies and manual labor to help with the crops.

Irma's goals as a mother are to keep investing in her children's schooling, supporting them as much as she can so that they can be better and achieve more; to continue to expand her business and her property so that she can leave her children a strong inheritance; and to keep her family life running.

loans.use: buy and transport farming supplies for growing coffee

loans.name: Bolivianitas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVIANITAS II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Porfiria es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de postres, venta de cargadores de bebe, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de pan, tienda de barrio, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Porfiria es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cargadores de bebe; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace cinco años cuando fue madre y vio el amplio comercio de esto productos, decide guardar un capital y emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cargadores de bebe por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro  hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “BOLIVIANITAS II” communal group is beginning its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, through its regional office in Villa Exaltación. The group is comprised of 9 members and is directed by a board of directors. Porfiria is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal group are running are: selling desserts, selling baby carriers, selling cosmetics, selling prepared foods, selling bread, selling cell phones and running a neighborhood store. 

The loan they take out will benefit small micro entrepreneurs, including Porfiria. She joined Pro Mujer 10 years ago, by invitation of a friend who is also a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling baby carriers. She informs us that she learned about this business 5 years ago when she became a mother and saw the ample marketability of these products. She decided to save up some capital and start her own business.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital (she buys the baby carriers wholesale). She will acquire them from the sellers in the city of La Paz and then sell them by request to her customers. This manner of business allows her to generate the resources to financially support her family. She is in a common law relationship and has 4 children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the healthcare center that the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase baby carriers wholesale.

loans.name: Primero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMERO DE MAYO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nadir es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ollas, servicio de transporte, venta de batidos, venta de ropa interior, venta de dulces, venta de chompas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nadir es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ollas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, ya que apoyaba en ese negocio y aprendió el comercio de estos artículos y en diferentes regiones. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ollas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene  dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The PRIMERO DE MAYO communal bank will start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación focus group, which is comprised of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Nadir is the President. The members’ businesses are varied, including ceramic pot sales, transportation services, milkshake sales, underwear sales, candy sales, sweater sales, food sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they’re taking out will benefit small businesses. Nadir, who is a member, said that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after she was invited by a friend who was a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling ceramic pots. She said that she learned this skill from her mother several years ago since she helped in that business and learned to sell these items in different regions.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy ceramic pots wholesale. She will get them from vendors in La Paz and then she’ll sell them by customer order. This form of work allows her to earn income to financially support her family since she is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the medical consultations that they offer.

loans.use: to buy ceramic pots wholesale.

loans.name: Rrezart

texts.en: Rrezart is 23 years old, lives with his parents and is very hardworking. His father works in the post office but Rrezart helps with the expenses and family by delivering pizza for Proper Pizza and is also a bee keeper, tending to his bees to sell the honey. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bees so that he can produce more honey for his family and for sales. He is very ambitious and hopes in the near future to have a large private business and dreams of many ways to ensure his success. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more bees so he can produce more honey for his family and for sales

loans.name: Ramon Mario

texts.es:
Ramon es un hombre de 54 años de edad, soltero, tiene dos hijos de 34 años y una hija de 18 años de edad, y su negocio es la construcción.
Él es buen padre, independiente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en la ciudad; que se encuentra en la zona de los valles a una altura aproximada de 2500 metros sobre el nivel mar, de clima templado durante todo el año.
Ramon es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, complexión física delgada, estatura alta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y también habla español como segunda lengua. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que trabajan y estudian, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su trabajo es la construcción, él se encarga de contratar personal para realizar construcciones en obra gruesa y obra fina de; casas, edificios y todo tipo de construcción, su labor la realiza de lunes a domingo hasta terminar, se trata de terminar rápido para comenzar otra obra; ‘yo trabajo por obra, me dan un plazo y el presupuesto, si termino antes, gano tiempo para encontrar otra construcción…’. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que lleva realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es construir su propia casa con todas las comodidades posibles, él desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión mediante la compra de una máquina mezcladora de cemento, para ahorrar tiempo y realizar el trabajo más rápido.
Es por esos motivos que Ramon solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina mezcladora de cemento para trabajar más rápido y conseguir otra construcción.
texts.en:
Ramon is a 54-year-old, single man who has two sons who are 34 years old and a daughter who is 18 years old.  His business is construction.  He is a good father, independent, persevering, active, responsible and hard-working.  He carries out his work traveling around the city which is located among valleys at an altitude of approximately 2,500 meters above sea level and has a temperate climate all year long.  

Ramon is tanned, has short black hair, a thin physical build and he is tall.  His mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in his city, and he also speaks Spanish as a second language.  He shares his life with his children who work and study.  They live in a rented house made of brinks that has well water and electricity.  

His work is construction. He is responsible for hiring workers to do construction work, both rough work and finishing work, on houses, buildings and on all types of construction jobs.  He works from Monday through Sunday until he is finished.  He tries to finish quickly so that he can start on another job: “I work by the job.  I am given a deadline and a budget.  If I finish early, then I gain time to start on another construction job.” 

This is his second loan sequence with the institution in the 15 years that he has been in this business.  His dream is to build his own house with all of the amenities possible.  He wants to expand his business by making an investment in it through the purchase of a cement mixing machine to save time and be able to do the job quicker.  

It is for these reasons that Ramon is requesting a loan to purchase a cement mixing machine – to work more quickly and get other construction jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a cement mixing machine to be able to work faster and get other construction jobs.

loans.name: Susanah

texts.en:
Clothes selling has been the core business for Susanah for the past five years. She also sells curtains and it has been profitable. The income she makes has helped her to provide for her family’s needs. She is 48 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of curtains and clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and save more. 

This is her first loan term from Vision Fund Kenya and in future she hopes to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children; one of them is currently in school. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells home accessories like plates. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more house accessories for sale, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standards of living. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to be a main supplier of home accessories. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more house accessories for sale.

loans.name: 30 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “30 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hortencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comidas, venta de cotillones, venta de regalos, venta de pollos, venta de cosméticos, venta de chicharrones de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hortencia es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una comadre que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción y venta de chicharrones de soya; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por recomendación de su hijo quien ya trabajaba con estos productos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de soya por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “30 DE OCTUBRE” [30th of October] Community Association will start their first lending cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Centre. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board in which Mrs. Hortencia is the president. The businesses that are carried forward by the members of the community association are varied, including: sale of food, sale of party goods, sale of presents, sale of chicken, sale of cosmetics, sale of chicken rinds.

The loan that they will get will benefit small business owners, including Hortencia. She indicates that eight years ago she joined Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of the godmother of her children, who is a customer of the institution. Currently, she has a business producing and selling soy rinds. She lets know that she started this business a few years ago by recommendation of her son, who already worked with these products.

The loan that she will get is meant to increase her capital (purchase of soybeans wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and after the production [of soy rinds], she will commercialise them in her store. This way of working permits her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training courses and the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy soybeans wholesale

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 33-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery; she knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns on bed covers and pillows. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Najma’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of six children. 

She wants to grow her business so has she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time and gain more profits. She also dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand and gain more profits.

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en:
Leah, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Leah is representing her group of six farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Leah has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Leah is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 2.5 acres will be planted by Leah's Group, and between them they will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, and a solar light.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past 15 years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her craft shop, which sells handcrafts.

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crafts to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve more on her craft business. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to take care of her health.

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to sell.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana tiene 46 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children and her husband. For the past several years, she has had a small store, which is located in the place where she lives. She has lots of customers as a result of her great prices and the kindness with which she executes her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc. so that she can increase her earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past 10 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his farming business, which does agriculture farming. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomato, egg plant and cabbage seeds, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and buy more materials that will help him in the farming business. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to improve on the good quality of produce. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more tomato, egg plant and cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Gulihon

texts.ru: Гулихон 45 лет, замужем, есть сын школьник. Образование среднее, на протяжении 24 лет Гулихон занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы и 5 овец. На участке мерою 0,1 Га она выращивает пшеницу для реализации. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулихон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Она планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на образование ее сына.
texts.en:
Gulihon is 45 years old, married, and has a school-aged son. She has a secondary education. For the last 24 years, Gulihon has been engaged in agriculture. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has on her homestead two cows and five sheep. On a plot of land measuring 0.1 hectares, she grows wheat for sale. Profits from running the business amount to 25,000 som (KGS) a month.

With the aim of further developing his business, Gulihon applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two steers.

She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business, in order to save money for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase two steers to invest in her business.

loans.name: Reencuentro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REENCUENTRO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de DVD’s, venta de shampoo, venta de muebles, venta de cosméticos, venta de choripan, venta de videos, venta de sogas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de videos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años al salir de un empleo, decide invertir sus ahorros en la compra de mercadería y ampliarlo aún más con un préstamo de Pro Mujer. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de videos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la forma de trabajar que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Reencuentro” will start their first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de los Andes. It is formed by eight members and it is managed by a board of directors in which Lucia is the president. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are diverse, and among them are the sale of DVDs, shampoo, furniture, cosmetics, choripan, videos and ropes. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs in which Lucia is a member. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for over 10 years, and she entered by a friend’s request who is a client of the institution. 

Nowadays, she has a business selling videos, and says that she started it ten years ago when she left her job and decided to invest her savings in the purchase of merchandise. This investment was increased with a loan from Pro Mujer

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (bulk purchase of videos) that will by acquired from the wholesalers of the city La Paz. After that she will sell them at her stand. 

This type of work allows her to generate incomes to support her family financially since she is single mother and has three children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the way the institution works.

loans.use: to purchase videos in bulk.

loans.name: Aidarali

texts.ru: Айдарали 55 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 5 детей. У Айдарали среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому уже много лет он занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,14 Га онвыращивает ячмень и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Айдарали составляет всего 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Aidarali is 55 years old, married, and with her husband is raising five children. Aidarali has a secondary education. Finding work in the village is very difficult and at the same time he needs to care for his family and to educate his children. Therefore, for many years he has been engaged in agriculture and currently has on his homestead five cows and ten sheep. On a plot measuring 1.14 hectares, he grows barley and corn. Aidarali's monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, he applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two calves to expand his livestock count.

He plans to invest proceeds from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals and building a bard for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy bull-calves in order to increase the livestock headcount.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is a 39-year-old, married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Shahzodda

texts.ru: Шахзодде 28 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается животноводством и земледелием. В одном большом доме кроме Шахзодды и ее мужа живут свекровь, братья супруга и их семья. Шахзодда самостоятельно работает дома и приносит в дом источник дохода. Она занимается животноводством. Во дворе Шахзодда имеет не больше место, где держит своих скотин. Она хочет увеличить доход от бизнеса с помощью получения кредита и купли несколько голов мелко рогатых скотов.
texts.en:
Shahzodda is 28 years old. She is married. Her husband raises livestock and crops. In one big home along with Shahzodda and her husband live her mother-in-law, husband's brothers and their families. Shahzodda works on her own in the house and brings a source of income to the house. She is engaged in raising livestock. In the yard, Shahzodda has a small place where she tends her livestock.

She wants to increase her income from the business with the help of a loan received and buying several head of small-horned livestock.

loans.use: to purchase several small-horned livestock.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es una mujer de 42 años de edad, viuda, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 18 años de edad, y una hija de 12 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes y venta de mantas.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por su feria los días jueves y domingo ‘donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja de cocer hasta un tractor para sembrar la tierra…’, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura constante entre 4 y 12 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Valeria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero) y su lengua materna es el aymara; para el comercio habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a sus dos hijos menores que estudian en la escuela, su hijo mayor ya es independiente y trabaja. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes de temporada y el comercio de mantas de vicuña, actividades que realiza por separado, vende juguetes los días de feria en un puesto de venta en la calle y los demás días vende mantas de vicuña a clientes fijos dueños de tiendas comerciales que realizan compras mensuales, ‘mi trabajo es por temporada, ahora es la temporada de juguetes, después viene la temporada de carnaval, el comercio de las mantas de vicuña es constante, realizo ambas actividades para pagar los gastos escolares de mis hijos…’. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales de bien y desea realizar la compra de variedad de juguetes como también de mantas para abastecer a sus clientes mensuales y ocasionales aprovechando las ventas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Valeria solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes y mantas de vicuña por mayor para mejorar las ventas de la temporada de navidad.
texts.en:
Valeria is a 42-year-old widowed woman, with two boys, ages 7 and 18, and a girl, 12 years old. She sells toys and shawls. She is a enterprising woman and a good mother; strong, feisty, responsible and hard-working. Valeria is short and dark, with long, black braided hair. Her style of dress is traditional (shawl, long skirt and hat) and her mother tongue is Aymara. For business, she speaks Spanish. She lives with her two minor children who are both in school. Her oldest son lives and works independently. 

Her business is in the 16 de Julio neighborhood, which is known for trading in all different sectors and its market held on Thursdays and Sundays "where you can buy everything from a sewing needle to a full-size tractor." The area has a cold, dry climate with temperatures consistently between 4 and 12 °C year-round.

Her business is selling seasonal toys and vicuña shawls, which she markets separately. She sells the toys on market days in a street stall and the other days, she sells vicuña shawls to steady customers in commercial stores. Those purchases are made monthly. "My work is seasonal; right now it's the toy season, then comes the Carnival season. The sale of vicuña shawls is constant. I do both jobs to pay for my children's schooling." 

This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the 5 years she has been in business. Her dream is for her children to have a career and be well off. And she hopes to buy a variety of toys and also shawls to supply her monthly and occasional customers and take advantage of the year-end sales. That is why Valeria is requesting a loan to purchase toys and vicuña shawls wholesale to improve her sales during the Christamas season.

loans.use: To purchase toys and vicuña blankets wholesale to improve her sales during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a 49-year-old married woman from Alyamon, a village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband and nine kids; five sons and four daughters. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income due to the low demand.

Feryal works on the family land, where she plants seasonal crops and olive trees. She sells the olive oil in the local market. Feryal would like to improve her business and expand it.

Feryal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for her farm. This will increase the farm productivity and also the income. Feryal appears in the photo on her land.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es: María esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar más leña y maíz, debido a que son los insumos indispensables para elaborar las tortillas, la vez anterior compro lo mismo; pero la demanda esta aumentando y necesita comprar más insumos.
texts.en: María is once again asking for a loan to buy more firewood and corn, since they are the essential supplies to make the tortillas. The previous time she bought the same items, but demand is increasing and she needs to buy more supplies.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and corn to make the tortillas

loans.name: Humayro

texts.ru: Хумайро женщина 30 лет. Родилась в Спитаменском районе . Замужем имеет двоих детей. Дочку и сына. Дети Хумайро ходят в садик. Несмотря на ежедневные  дела по хозяйству Хумайро  уделяет своё время своим детям. Хумайро очень близка к природе. Она выращивает комнатные цветы. Весной закупает семена необычно красивых цветов и сажает в огород.  Муж Хумайро занимается бизнесом. Хумайро сама очень старательная женщина.Чтоб не только заниматься домашними делами попросила мужа купить ей КРС. У нее хороший опыт в сфере животноводства.  Кроме того она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. У неё очень хорошая фантазия. Чтоб повысить свое знание и развить знание своих детей она хочет купить компьютер. Для этого ей нужны  средства. В связи с чем она обратилась в организацию Арванд за помощью. Она заранее выражает свою  благодарность  Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Humayro is a woman of 30. She was born in the Spitamen region. She is married and has two children: a daughter and a son. Humayro's children go to kindergarten. Despite the daily activities of the household, Humayro devotes her time to her children. Humayro is very close to nature. She grows potted plants. In the spring, she buys seeds of unusually beautiful flowers and plants them in the garden. Humayro's husband is involved in the business. Humayro herself is a very industrious woman. Such that she would not be involved only in domestic activities, her husband bought her cattle. She has good experience in the sphere of animal husbandry. Besides that, she sews national dresses. She has a very good imagination.

In order to increase her knowledge and to develop the knowledge of her children, she wants to buy a computer. For this, she needs money. In connection with that she applied to the organization Arvand for help. She expresses her gratitude in advance to Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Francies' Group

texts.en:
Francies is 70 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has 6 children and is married. As a group leader, Francies is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya. He is excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Francies's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

Francies and his group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kahaso's Group

texts.en: Kahaso is a fifty-four-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has eleven children, all of whom are in school. Kahaso is married and her spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Kahaso also cultivates maize, cowpeas and green peas and supports her family with income from her working children. She decided to join Komaza because the organization's objective is to reduce poverty and she plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a business. Kahaso’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting trees. Kahaso is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Brisas San Juan Group

texts.es:
The peaceful town of San Juan la Laguna is located on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala.  It is here that seven Maya Tz’utujil women with a median age of 38 and an education level of 6 years have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas San Juan” or “The Breezes of San Juan.”  The ladies are united in their goal of eliminating poverty in order to better their quality of life especially for their children. Each has an average of four children.
Maria, 63 years old, is the oldest member of the group.  She has only a primary school education but has provided her children with a complete formal education.  Together with her husband, she make sports clothing which the couple sells in town and surrounding areas.  Right now, they need more material to continue their production.  Therefore, Maria is requesting a loan to buy thread, fabrics, elastic and other supplies.
The members of “Brisas San Juan” and Doña Maria are enthusiastic about the beneficial education program component of their monthly meetings. Through the knowledge that they gain about useful and practical subjects, the ladies acquire valuable tools for their personal and business lives. Each woman is encouraged by increased self-esteem and empowerment as well as enhanced productivity.  The ladies are hopeful that the KIVA investors will continue to support them and thus, help to raise their standard of living and eliminate poverty in their community of San Juan La Laguna.
texts.en:
The peaceful town of San Juan la Laguna is located on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala.  It is here that seven Maya Tz’utujil women with a median age of 38 and an education level of 6 years have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas San Juan” or “The Breezes of San Juan.”  The ladies are united in their goal of eliminating poverty in order to better their quality of life, especially for their children. Each has an average of four children.

Maria, 63 years old, is the oldest member of the group.  She has only a primary school education but has provided her children with complete formal educations.  Together with her husband, she makes sports clothing which the couple sells in town and surrounding areas.  Right now, they need more material to continue their production.  Therefore, Maria is requesting a loan to buy thread, fabrics, elastic and other supplies.

The members of “Brisas San Juan” and Doña Maria are enthusiastic about the beneficial education program component of their monthly meetings. Through the knowledge that they gain about useful and practical subjects, the ladies acquire valuable tools for their personal and business lives. Each woman is encouraged by increased self-esteem and empowerment as well as enhanced productivity.  The ladies are hopeful that the Kiva investors will continue to support them and thus help to raise their standard of living and eliminate poverty in their community of San Juan La Laguna.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabrics, elastic and other supplies

loans.name: Shakilah

texts.en:
SHAKILAH is 33 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past ten years, SHAKILAH has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar and soap . 

To help expand her business, SHAKILAH has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items like sugar, soap, water,and bread for sale, and will help SHAKILAH to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. SHAKILAH hopes that in the future she will be able to become the biggest wholesale supplier in town. 

SHAKILAH is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like SHAKILAH who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items like sugar, soap, water, and bread for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his farming business, which sells fresh milk.

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows that will produce more milk for sale, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and improve on providing for his family's basic needs. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to complete his rental houses.

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows that will produce more milk for sale.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es: jose de 66 años de edad posee un taller de reparación y elaboración calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose, 66 years old, has a shoemaking and shoe repair shop. He has his shop in his place of residence. He has a lot of customers because of the quality of the product. With what he earns from his sales he is able to move ahead with his household's expenses. Jose lives in his own house with his wife. He is asking for a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc. in order to continue making shoes, since that is his only source of work, and in this way have a better quality of life along with his family.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the bar business alongside farming, where he grows bananas, cassava, coffee and other things to earn an extra income. He started this business because it was so profitable and to have a better life. He faces a challenge of competition, price fluctuations and weather changes that affect his business. He has a vision of expanding his business and owning a big depot.

He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale undergarments of different prices, styles and colors.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en: Hranush is farmer from the village of Basen in Shirak, Armenia. She and her husband have been running their family farm since they were married. Also, Hranush's husband is a seasonal migrant worker, leaving the main farm work to Hranush. She keeps their cows, calves, sheep, pigs and hens and also cultivates wheat, barley and a large variety of fruit trees (apricot, plum, apple and nut). Hranush's husband, using his own truck, takes the harvest to the nearby market and sells it. To enlarge their farm, Hranush is requesting a loan of USD3,000 to purchase forage for feeding the livestock, fertilizer and seeds (1.5 tonnes). The support and trust of the lenders are very important to Hranush.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock, fertilizer and seeds (1.5 tonnes).

loans.name: Beatrices' Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Beatrice, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. She is 31 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Beatrice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. This means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Beatrice says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Beatrice will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is a young farmer living in Kirants Village. She lives there with her parents-in-law, husband and two children. All her family is occupied in agriculture. The farm which they run includes a big livestock and land where they cultivate wheat, corn, haricot and potato. 

The barn where they keep their cattle is too old and needs to be renovated. Naira, asks this loan of USD 1500 to be able to organize the renovation of the barn and be prepared for the winter. She also plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. 

Naira and her whole family hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en: Joseph is 51 years old and has nine children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always referred to as very experienced. Even though Joseph is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 13 farmers in the Kakamega North District of Kenya. Joseph started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then he has seen his life improve, especially in terms of his health due to better nutrition. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. Joseph’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of nine acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the harvest season.

loans.name: Andy Steveen

texts.es: Andy es un joven de 19 años de edad, el vive en la casa de sus padres, con su hijo de 3 meses y con la madre de sus hijo,  son 2 años que se dedica  al comercio de papas,  gracias a que sus padres le enseñan a  la realización de este negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en papas para seguir en su actividad, ya que dice que este negocio es el sustento de su hogar y espera seguir teniendo buenos ingresos y en algún momento retomar sus estudios que los dejo por motivo de que ya no le alcanzó sus recursos económicos.
texts.en: Andy is a 19 year-old youth who lives in his parent's house with his 3 month-old son and the mother of his child.  He's been selling potatoes for 2 years, thanks to his parents who taught him this business.  He will invest this loan in merchandise, buying potatoes so that he can continue with this activity, because he says that this business supports his household.  He hopes to continue to get good earnings, and he also hopes at some point to return to school, which he left due to a lack of financial resources.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en: Samuel, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very hard-working individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader. Samuel is representing a group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year. Samuel has been a farmer for eight years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Samuel is planning to send his children to school. A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Samuel's Group and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en: These are the four members of the universal loan group. They are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm for improving their lives. A few years back, they were all facing poverty, so they decided to join ID-Ghana to acquire loans to improve their businesses. They are into the sale of fresh fish, mosquito coil, material, slip on sandals, and waakye (cooked rice and beans). The featured borrower is Comfort, who is 52 years old, married and has two children. In the picture, she is standing second from right. She earns a living by selling fresh fish to help her husband financially. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the community and likes being able to meet their needs. She has a plan to expand and service all her customers' needs. She wants to buy fish from the fishermen directly at wholesale prices, and that is why she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy fish from the fishermen directly at wholesale prices and sell to customers.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer from Jaki village, in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, for a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. Musa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха женщина 50 лет ,замужем , мать пятерых  детей. Она выросла в сельской местности и с детства работала на поле ,помогала родителям ,ухаживала за скотом , вырастила своих братьев и сестер,потому что родители работали день и ночь ,чтобы обеспечить своим детям лучшую жизнь . В возрасте 30 лет Солиха поставив на ноги своих детей ,решила заняться бизнесом. Сейчас она арендует помещение на рынке ,где занимается торговлей женской и детской одежды . Торговля идёт хорошо ,у неё есть постоянные клиенты ,которым нравится товар и обслуживание. Сейчас она хочет приобрести новую партию товара ,но у нее нет полной суммы денег .Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой . Солиха надеется ,что МДО Арванд откликнется на её просьбу и выделет нужную сумму дял продолжения и расширения её бизнеса.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Soliha is a 50-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of five children. She was born in the countryside and since childhood has worked in the field, helping her parents, tending the livestock, raising her brothers and sisters, because her parents worked day and night in order to support their children with a better life. At the age of 30, Soliha in order to put her children on their feet, decided to get involved in business. Currently, she is renting a market spot, where she sells women's and children's clothing. Trade is going well; she has regular customers who like her goods and service.

Now she wants to purchase a new parcel of goods, but she does not have the full amount. Therefore, she applied to MDO Arvand for financial support.

Soliha hopes that MDO Arvand will accept her request and disburse the needed sum for continuing and expanding her business. She gives her thanks in advnace for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy a shipment.

loans.name: Flor Paceñita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR PACEÑITA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jimena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de chuño y tunta por mayor, venta de chamarras, venta de joyas, venta de queso, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jimena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de bisutería en fantasía; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, ya que ella necesitaba generar recursos para poder establecer su carrera, es por ello que ella emprende este negocio de una forma independiente a su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de joyas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.

Al grupo acompañan dos personas una que esta cargada un bebe y la otra que esta detrás de las socias, ellas son hermanas de las clientes que querían aparecer en la imagen.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FLOR PACEÑITA” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Villa Exaltación. It is formed by eight members and is governed by an executive committee where Jimena is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry forward are varied, and among them are: food sales, athletic clothing sales, wholesale freeze-dried potatoes sales, poncho blanket sales, jewelry sales, cheese sales, and milk sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Jimena is a member. This is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling fantasy costume jewelry. She learned this business from her mother several years ago. Since she needed to generate resources, and in order to be able to establish her career, she started this business independently from her mother.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase the capital (purchase of wholesale jewelry) that she will acquire from the sellers in the city of La Paz and later she will sell it by request to customers. This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to financially support her studies.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and medical clinic that the institution offers.

Two people accompany the group, one who is responsible for a baby and the other who is behind the members. They are sisters of the clients who wanted to appear in the picture.

loans.use: to buy wholesale jewelry.

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a 47-year-old single woman from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin City. She lives with her family in a simple house.

Intesar works on the family land where she plants seasonal crops and olive trees. She sells the olive oil in the local market. Intesar would like to improve her business and expand it.

Intesar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for her farm. This will increase the farm's productivity and also the income. Intesar appears in the photo on her land.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is 48 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years Enid has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Enid has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more women's and men's clothes for sale, and will help Enid to generate greater profits and contribute on some of the basic school needs. Enid hopes that in the future she will be able to see her family in a good and healthy condition. 

Enid is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Enid who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and men's clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
JACKLYN is 29 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past five years, JACKLYN has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, JACKLYN has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more kids' clothes bed sheets and other types of clothing for sale, and will help JACKLYN to generate greater profits and take care of herself. JACKLYN hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her business. 

JACKLYN is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like JACKLYN who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more kids' clothes, bed sheets and other types for sale,

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PODEROSAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos, venta de helados, venta de comida, taller de costura, compra y venta de ganado, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al trabajar como vendedora en una tienda de ropa, posteriormente con sus ahorros emprende un negocio independiente pues ya conocía el mercado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
