She hopes that her hard work will help her expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Juliet has been in her current line of work for two years and also earns additional income by running a general store. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alh. Magaji

texts.en: Alh. Magaji is a maize farmer from Lili village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the harvest-time market price. Alh. Magaji, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en: Matiyu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Matiyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Matiyu can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Matiyu is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
CEste grupo de 17 señoras se llama Renacer, todas tiene la esperanza de poder comenzar un nuevo desafío a través del programa de comité de mujeres, son luchadoras, sacrificadas y quiere salir adelante.
Se destaca la Sra. Susana, una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, quien con mucho sacrificio pudo montar para su propia despensa, ella por medio de este negocio ayuda a su familia, es por eso que pone todo de si.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, y de esa forma poder surtirla y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
This group of 17 women is called “Renacer" [rebirth].  All of them hope to be able to begin a new challenge through the women’s committee program.  They are fighters—sacrificers who want to get ahead.

Susana stands out; she is a humble and hardworking woman who, through great sacrifice, managed to launch her own small store.  Through this business she is helping her family.  It is because of this that she is doing all she does.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy various items for her small store.  In this way she can stock it and keep giving her customers everything that she couldn’t have.

loans.use: to buy various supplies to stock her small store.

loans.name: Curahuara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CURAHUARA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ediberta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio de ganado, costura de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de charque, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ediberta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de aguayos; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido para exportación. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank Curahuara is starting the second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is made up of ten members and is headed by a board where Ediberta is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and between them they are: cattle trade, sewing skirts, neighborhood store, selling dried llama meat, and selling food.

The loan they are taking will benefit those micro-entrepreneurs where Ediberta is a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years joining through the invitation of an Advisor of the institution who visited her at home.

Currently she has a business selling weavings and multicolored woolen cloths. She tells us that she learned this work from her parents. Since she was a child she helped them in the family business. Now that she has an independent family she began her own business.

The loan that she is taking now is for working capital (to buy wool in bulk) that she will buy from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz for later creations for export trade orders.

This form of work has permitted her to generate resources to support her family as she lives with a life partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk

loans.name: San Lorenzo  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sitio Mapasingue en  la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito San Lorenzo. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. Ellas decidieron unirse para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la institución y con los créditos mejorar  sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Beatriz, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es jubilado. Ella es modista desde hace muchos años, aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Beatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para sacar adelante a su familia, ella instalo un pequeño taller de costura en  su casa donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, ella  confecciona a personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa ya que conocen la calidad de su trabajo, la seriedad y puntualidad para entregar los mismos, lleva más de 40 años dedicada a esta profesión con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y otros materiales de costura que ella necesita para confeccionar sus prendas. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le están ayudando mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The San Lorenzo credit group meets every two weeks in the Mapasingue area of the Colon parrish in the city of Portoviejo.  These women work in various sectors such as agriculture and trade.  They decided to get together in order to be able to access the benefits that the institution offers, and with their loans to improve their businesses.

One of the group members is Beatriz.  She is 54 years old and is married.  From her marriage she has three adult children, one of whom lives with them.  Her husband is retired.  She has been a fashion designer for many years.  She learned to design and sew at a local academy.

Beatriz is a very hardworking woman who likes to take advantage of opportunities to get her family ahead.  She put in a small seamstress workshop in her home, where she works to sew every type of clothing.  She sews for individuals who come to her house because they know of the quality of her work, the seriousness with which she works, and her punctuality in delivering the orders.  She has been in this profession for more than 40 years, and it is how she earns something for the good of her family.

This loan is to buy thread, fabric, zippers, and other sewing supplies that she needs in order to sew her outfits.  This is her second loan cycle in the credit group, and she likes it because the loans are helping her a lot.  Her dream is to get ahead.  

The small photo is of a group member who couldn’t be there when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, zippers, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes Maricela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 64 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene tres hijos mayores, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos.  Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta trabajar ayudar a mantener el hogar, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, detergentes, carne, pescado, queso, productos de bazar y tintes para cabello, ella también vende ropa de todo tipo ya sea en su local o recorriendo la ciudad,  así se gana algo extra que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido a veces no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo, ella tiene más de 30 años con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su tienda y ropa. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusión meets biweekly in Cadí's parrish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its hardworking people, who are mainly farmers.

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 64 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has three adult chidren, one of whom is still living at home. Her husband is a farmer.

Mercedes likes to work in order to help support her household. She has a grocery store where she sells all sorts of basic products like oil, rice, meat, fish, cheese, detergents, hair dye, and other items. She also sells all types of clothing at her store as well as in the city as a street vendor. This allows her to make some extra income in order to get ahead, since her husband sometimes doesn't earn much money from his labor in the fields.  She has been in business for over thirty years.

She will use this loan to stock up on more basic products for her store and clothing items. She is one of the founding members of this communal bank and appreciates the benefits offered by the organization. Her goal is to further increase her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and clothing.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Lilian has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Lilian also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Lilian's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jessica is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell for her used shoes selling business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maximillah's Group

texts.en:
Maximillah, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Maximillah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

Maximillah plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Maximillah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 11.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Reuben's Group

texts.en:
Reuben is 53 years old and the proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual.  He is representing his group of 14 farmers in Teso District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Reuben has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.  Reuben described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to be buying a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  Now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Reuben’s group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Teso District. She is 58 years old, is married and has 8 children.

Emily likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Emily plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Emily’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, so the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Emmaculate's Group

texts.en:
Emmaculate is 50 years old and has two children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Emmaculate has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Emmaculate also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Emmaculate's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 10.5 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: John Coach

texts.en:
John Coach is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, John Coach would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, John Coach can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, John Coach is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to ensure that his children, Titus, Rita and Nuhu, are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. 

John has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to send his children to school .  Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

John also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about.  It will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that John's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres."

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old and has 7 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Agnes is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Agnes started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Agnes’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres of land. Additionally, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron, steel, sand, and gravel, to build extra rooms in his house

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a maize farmer from Ranau Danmantai village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sunday would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sunday can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Sunday, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Inusa had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Inusa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income he earns to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene un hijo y también su pareja, comenta que trabaja con su hermano en su empresa como instalador de ventanas de blindex y otros.
Él a la vez que trabaja también estudia la carrera de análisis de sistemas, y comenta que su mayor meta es terminar su carrera para acceder a un título universitario y seguir capacitándose para ascender y progresar en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación.
texts.en:
Mario lives in the city of Pilar. He has one child and is also in a relationship. Mario says that he works with his brother at a company where he is responsible for installing Blindex brand windows and other products.

While he is working, Mario is also studying for degree in Systems Analysis. He says that his greatest wish is to finish his degree so that he can receive his university diploma. Mario would like to continue his training so that he can advance and progress in life.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in his degree expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his degree expenses.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 57 años de edad, está casada vive con su esposo y con sus dos nietos. Tiene 3 hijos todos mayores, los mismos se encuentran trabajando en el Japón.
Ella comenta que de muy joven viajó al Japón en busca de mejores oportunidades de vida, allí trabajó por mas de 5 años y fue allí donde conoció a su esposo, juntaron un capital y decidieron volver al país, compraron una casa y dos vacas lecheras desde entonces se dedica a la venta de leche, y como actividad adicional se dedica a la venta de bocaditos sobre pedido. Cabe mencionar que por medio de su trabajo ella y su esposo han podido criar a sus hijos.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de una vaca lechera, para poder cubrir con toda la demanda de leche que tiene, ya que actualmente no está pudiendo cubrir la totalidad de los mismos.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca is 57 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two grandchildren.  She has three adult children who are currently working in Japan.  

She says that when she was very young she travelled to Japan in search of better opportunities in life.  There she worked for more than five years and it was there that she met her husband.  They pulled together some money and decided to return to her country.  They bought a house and two dairy cows; since then they have worked selling milk.  As an additional job, she sells snacks made to order.  

It is worth mentioning that, due to their work, she and her husband have been able to care for their children.  The requested loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow, in order to be able to meet the demand for milk that she has, because currently she can’t keep up with demand.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is divorced and has four children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past eight years, Violet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Violet has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items like sugar, soap, water, and bread for sale, and it will help Violet to generate greater profits and help in paying for some of her children's school needs like books. 

Violet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a very big supermarket. 

Violet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Violet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items like sugar, soap, water, and bread for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more ladies' and gents' shirts and trousers for the shop, and it will help Rehema to generate greater profits and take good care of her family. 

Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to own the largest boutique in town. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more ladies' and gents' shirts and trousers for the shop.

loans.name: Domitila Filadelfia

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive la señora Domitila, tiene 68 años, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos pero uno falleció, los cuatro son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Domitila y su esposo tienen vacas lecheras que con los créditos han ido comprando, los mismos que producen hasta 12 litros de leche al día, con este crédito quieren comprar otra vaca para aumentar su producción la cual les permite salir adelante, ella también tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos, los mismos que tiene por espacio de dos a tres meses y luego los pela y los entrega en tiendas o los vende por libras a personas de la localidad, la leche la distribuyen por litros a los vecinos . Llevan más de 17 años en esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar una vaca y  alimentos para los animales.  Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir aumentado la producción de leche.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusión meets biweekly in Cadí's parrish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its hardworking people, who are mainly farmers.

This is where Domitila lives. She is 68 years old, married, and had five children from this relationship, one of whom passed away. The other four are all adults now living on their own. Her husband is a farmer.

Domitila and her husband have dairy cows, which they have gradually purchased with previous loans. They produce up to twelve liters of milk per day. They want to use this loan to buy another cow in order to increase production and get ahead. She also has a small chicken farm where she raises chickens. She keeps them for a period of two or three months, and then butchers them and sells them to the stores or directly to other neighbors by the pound. They also sell their milk to the neighbors by the liter. They have been in business for over seventeen years.

She will use this loan to buy a cow and animal feed. She is one of the founding members of her communal bank and she really appreciates the loans because they have helped her a lot. Her goal is to continue increasing her milk production.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Merly is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old. She is married and has 3 children. 2 of her children are currently in school, and Adelaida works hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines, a business she has been in for 2 years now. 

Through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Adelaida is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to be able to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to be able to afford for her children to continue their studies at college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Maresa works hard to provide for her family.

Maresa has a gasoline retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling credit for mobile phones. 

Maresa is requesting a loan of 1,300 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy a solar lamp for her gasoline retail business.

Maresa has managed to sustain her business activities through her previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en: Sabreen is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in AlRusaifeh. Sabreen and her husband are supporting a family of seven members, Sabreen sells blankets and bed covers from home and her husband is a lawyer. Her business challenge is lack of liquidity. Sabreen is applying for a loan to bring more merchandise of blankets.

loans.use: to bring more merchandise of blankets.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is 23 years old and has knocked on many doors looking for a job, just to hear “no”. Despite being single, he is a strong farmer, confident on his decisions. Today, with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the good Kiva lenders, he wants to expand his horticulture business and plant more maize and grow more crops. He heard a “yes” from Juhudi Kilimo, and is seeking a loan to expand his horticultural farm. He would like to plant more maize and other crops but the cost of inputs is very prohibitive. He is going for a loan as a jump start. Once he makes his harvest, he will plow the profits back into the business to pay for next season's input costs. Your loan will help his parents and siblings to become financially independent through constant growth of their business income. The money from the investment will go toward improving the quality of life being led by his family and also to his siblings’ education.

loans.use: To expand his horticultural farm, plant more maize and other crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barbed wire to fence his farm.

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara lives in Stepanavan village with her two kids (ages 7 and 1 years old).  Her husband migrated to Russia, hoping to find a well-paid job and sustain his family's living. 

To support her husband financially and cover her children's daily costs, Donara has been involved in agriculture for many years.  She keeps cows, calves, pigs, and piglets on her farm. 

She takes care of her farm with great love and pleasure.  The income she gets is very important for her to cover daily needs. 

Donara has applied for this loan to buy a cow and forage for feeding her livestock. This is very important for Donara, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a maize farmer from Jalawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the harvest-time market price. Emmanuel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Charle's Group

texts.en:
"Charles is a 39-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Charles has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Charles described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Charles’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Merab's Group

texts.en:
Merab is a 53-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Merab has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Merab described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Merab’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 40-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Joseph has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joseph described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty is often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 30 years old, and as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Teso Distric, Kenya.  She is married and has 4 children.

Betty is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she originally decided to join. Betty says that she is happy to have made that decision, because since she first joined in 2012, she has learned a lot from farming training, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Betty will use the profits from this season to buy a goat.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. Some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights.  With this loan, the group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Hebert's Group

texts.en:
"Hebert's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Teso District and is being represented by Hebert, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 35 years old, is married and has four children. Hebert has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Hebert isn’t new to One Acre Fund.  He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Hebert will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Hebert's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: San Agustín Group

texts.es:
Son 20 mujeres  que con dedicación y lucha diaria podrán solventar los gastos del hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos con sus labores diarias. De aquí se formó el grupo San Agustín en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
La Sra. Cecilia se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité, ella pudo emprender la elaboración de artículos de limpiezas, elabora dichos productos y se dedica a la venta. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos para poder hacer sus productos de limpieza, ya que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir con sus ventas.
Todas están contentas, ya que a través del programa de comités podrán ir superándose.
texts.en:
There are twenty women who with dedication fight daily to pay the household expenses and above all to increase their income through their daily labors. Thus the San Agustin Group was formed in the city of Carapeguá. 

Cecilia is happy to be a part of the committee as she could begin producing cleaning products, making and selling the products. She is asking for this loan in order to buy the supplies for making her cleaning products, as it will be helpful and she can continue with her sales.

All of them are happy because through the communal bank they can succeed.

loans.use: to buy supplies to produce cleaning projects

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia está estudiando la carrera de enfermería educacional, comenta que su meta es defender su tesis para desarrollarse en su profesión.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza por poder crecer y salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia a su carrera y poder retribuirles todo el esfuerzo que han hecho por ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sonia is studying for a degree in Educational Nursing. She says that her goal is to defend her thesis so that she can develop in this profession.

Sonia is a person who strives to grow and move forward so that she can help her family with her degree. She would like to repay them for everything they have done for her.

Sonia is requesting this loan so that she can pay for her university fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is a widow and has two children, with one of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Jane has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a hand dryer and some hair relaxers, and it will help Jane to generate greater profits and buy some basic needs at home. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to have the best beauty salon around town. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a hand dryer and some hair relaxers.

loans.name: 26 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “26 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soledad es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de frutas, producción de frutas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soledad es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de frutas; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abono por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la cosecha lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The 26 of October organization will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Center. The group is composed of eight members and is directed by a council of which Señora Soledad is the treasurer. The businesses owned by the members of the association are varied and include food sales, sale of fruits and fruit production.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit the group of micro entrepreneurs of which Señora Soledad is a member. She was brought into Pro Mujer by one of its loan officers who visited her at her residence. At the present time she owns a business in the production and sale of fruit. She informs us that she learned this business from her parents, since from childhood she helped out in the family enterprise. Now that she has her own family, she has decided to begin her own business undertaking.

Her request is for an increase in capital for the purchase of fertilizer at wholesale rates, which she will acquire from dealers in the city of La Paz. Later, she will sell her crop in the markets of the city of El Alto. This form of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in a common law marriage and has two children. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she appreciates the training that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer at wholesale rates.

loans.name: Lady Katiuska

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive la señora Lady, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años que está en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Lady es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes y cosas para el hogar, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes y zapatos. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a aumentar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusión meets biweekly in Cadí's parrish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its hardworking people, who are mainly farmers.

This is where Lady lives. She is 22 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has a four-year-old son who is in kindergarten. Her husband is a driver.

Lady is a housewife who decided to earn her own income. In order to help her husband with their household expenses, she sells clothing, shoes, fragrances, and household items. She works three days a week between two and three hours per day. She delivers her products on credit and collects payment from her customers weekly. She has been in this business for three years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, fragrances, and shoes. She has been a member of her communal bank for over three years and enjoys it because the loans have helped her increase her business. Her dream is to have a car in order to go out and sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fragrances, and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fuel and repairs to her long-distance delivery truck.

loans.name: Cherie Pie

texts.en:
As the mother of one child, Cherie Pie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling charcoal.  

Cherie Pie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell for her business.

Cherie Pie has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 32 years old and has two children. Delia is married and has one child in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been in business for two years now.  She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Editha works hard to support her family.  She has a fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from processed foods. Editha  is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits to sell for her fruit business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 51 years old and married.  She has three children. With two children in school, Erma works very hard to provide for them.  Erma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Erma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Ethel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling processed foods in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store.  Ethel is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her processed-foods business.

Ethel has sustained her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more processed foods to sell

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simon is a humble young man who lives in Eldoret, an area pummeled not only by violence, but also by poverty. Nonetheless there are people there who want to make progress and show that they don’t have to keep living that same story. One of these is Simon, who is 24 years of age, hardworking and energetic. He hails from Kipkenyo, a remote village in Eldoret, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming. 

Simon is still single and has been doing farming for the past three years. Simon was raised in a humble family, and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of lack of tuition fees. As a result of this, he never got any formal employment and didn’t surrender to that. He started farming, and through farming he has been able to take care of his family and also to take care of his parents. 

Simon's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Eldoret area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Simon is kindly seeking a loan to buy another motorbike. 

Through the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Simon is very determined to succeed and because he is much disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. 

Simon's dream is to go back to school and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to transport goods to market.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Don Gregorio, tiene 39 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el departamento de Intibucá, siempre se a dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas. Lleva mas de 20 años de tener su propio cultivo de papas y hortalizas como repollo y otros. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener sus cultivos bien asistidos. Actualmente solicita otro de 20,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, insecticidas, fungicidas y para limpieza con el objetivo de mejorar las cosechas y los ingresos para la familia. Su sueño a futuro es que además de dedicarse a la agricultura también a la ganadería.
texts.en:
Don Gregorio is 39 years old, married, and has six children. He lives in the Department of Intibucá. Gregorio has always engaged in farm work. He has been cultivating his own crops of potatoes, onions, and other vegetables for more than 20 years. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market.

Gregorio has requested several loans in order to keep his crops well-maintained. He is currently asking for another loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL so that he can buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, and also pay for weeding. His goal is to improve his harvest and his family’s earnings.

Gregorio’s dream for the future is to remain in agriculture, but also expand into livestock breeding.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, and also pay for the weeding of his potato fields.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is 50 years old and lives with her two sons, husband and mother-in-law.  Asya owns seven cows, sheep, piglets and hens. She milks cows every day and produces dairy products to sell locally.  This is the only source of income for her family. 

Asya decided to enlarge her agribusiness and requested a loan. She will use the loan to purchase  two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. 
This loan will give her a chance to increase her family income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Agrey's Group

texts.en:
"Agrey is a 50-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Agrey has noticed that he has a larger farm group support.

Agrey described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a goat.

With this loan, Agrey’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia grew up in Cuba, but spent 20 years in Italy before coming to the United States. She says, “I did many events and participated in social activities until I discovered I wanted to be my own boss and create employment to my community. In 2010 I launched the cleaning business, dedicated to providing highly personalized, unique services to our clients.” 

She has two employees and her business supports herself and her son.
 
Since opening her business, Leticia has worked hard to grow her client base. One particular highlight was getting the contract to work with the Villa Vizcaya, one of the major museums and historical sites in Miami. On her company website, the Deputy Director for Collections and Curatorial Affairs wrote, “Thank you for the excellent service. It all made for a good closure of a good event.”

With such great customer feedback, Leticia is excited to “continue growing, win more contracts and help the community by creating dignified jobs with fair wages.” 

This is her first loan with Accion. She will use this loan to secure the necessary insurance for larger contracts. This insurance helps protect both Leticia and her clients and having this insurance will improve Leticia’s ability to get cleaning contracts.

You can view her business website here: http://www.montecarlocleaningservices.com/

loans.use: to purchase cleaning services insurance, required for larger cleaning contracts.

loans.name: Eugenia Mabel

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive la señora Eugenia, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Eugenia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio,    vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, cortinas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con el cual se gana lo suyo por el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusión meets biweekly in Cadí's parrish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its hardworking people, who are mainly farmers.

This is where Eugenia lives. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship, who are ages eight and six. Both children are in school. Her husband is a cab driver.

Eugenia is a fighter. She likes being able to fend for herself in order to get ahead. She works retail so that she can help her husband with their household expenses. She sells all types of clothing, sheets, curtains, quilts, and other items. She sells door-to-door as well as at home when her customers need an item and come to her there. She leaves the merchandise with them on credit and collects her payment weekly. She has been in this business for over five years, and it allows her to make her own money, which is best for her family.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing items. She has been with her communal bank for two cycles and enjoys it because she can use the loans to finance her business. Her goal is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita is 45 years old and married.  She has six children. With five children in school, Pelita works very hard to provide for them.

Pelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc..

Pelita has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Pelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jo

texts.en:
Mary Jo is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jo is 27 years old and has one child in school.

Mary Jo has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Mary Jo requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to  buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business to restart her business activities.

Mary Jo has been in this business for three years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Mary Jo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melita works hard to support her family.  She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Melita is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Melita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married, with six children. She is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Norma has a business retailing spices in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Norma has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell.

Norma has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 35-year-old farmer living in Lernantsq village, Lori region. She is a widow with a 17-year-old son. 

Together with her mother-in-law, Lilit runs a farm. They keep a big livestock of cows, calves, sheep, pig, piglets, rabbits, and hens. Near the house where they live, Lilit also cultivates potato.
 
All family members work hard to make their farming business profitable and gather income for the family.
 
Lilit has applied for the loan to be able to make some improvements on her farm. She plans to purchase a cow, an ox and pay for the renovation of the barn for the cattle. 

She hopes for lenders' support as the loan is very important for her farm.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, an ox and renovation of the barn for the cattle.

loans.name: Arnold's Group

texts.en: Arnold is a fifty-three year old Komaza tree farmer. He has six children, all of whom are in school. Arnold is married and his wife is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Arnold also cultivates subsistence crops and supports his family with farming. He decided to join Komaza to improve agricultural practices and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees for his children. Arnold’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the that the partnership makes high-quality trees accessible. Arnold is the farmer with the green shirt in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Kasiwa's Group

texts.en:
Kasiwa is a 42-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He is married with has three children, two of whom are in school. 

Both Kasiwa and his wife are farmers, and their agricultural endeavors are affected by droughts, pests and diseases. Kasiwa joined the Komaza program so that he can build a permanent house for his family and send his children to school with the money he earns from his tree farm. 

He enjoys the trainings offered by Komaza facilitators and the short-term crops projects. Kasiwa is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is farmer living in Noravan village. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two school-aged children. 

It has been already nine years that Alisa runs a farm. She keeps livestock (two cows, ten sheep, calves, and fifteen hens) as well as cultivating wheat, haricot, and potatoes. 

To be able to purchase new seeds and organize her cultivation process, Alisa has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation.

The loan will be a great improvement for Alisa and her family farm, so she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Sara's Group

texts.en:
Sara, pictured above, has been a farmer for 14 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Teso District. She is 26 years old, is married, and has 7 children.

Sara likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Sara plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy more land to cultivate.

In total, Sara’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Cruzche Iii Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cruzche III” is pleased to report that they have just successfully finished their very first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, funded by KIVA investors. This gave them the opportunity to sustain and expand their small businesses. The ladies are requesting a new loan and are most hopeful that KIVA investors will fund it.

In the previous loan cycle, we shared the story of Fermina, a 36 year-old woman, who has a palm mat business. She wants to express her appreciation to KIVA investors for their financial help. With her loan, Fermina was able to maintain her palm mat business and generate an income. Because she is an ambitious woman and has five children, Fermina recently decided to start an animal husbandry business. She wants to buy pigs and is hopeful that this new business, combined with her palm mat business, will enable her to generate additional income and raise the standard of living for her five children.
Friendship Bridge believes that for best results in eliminating poverty, microcredit must be combined with education, or “Microcredit Plus”. The organization believes that the small loans provide clients with assistance with their businesses while education provides them skills and knowledge or assets for life.

KIVA investors are greatly appreciated for their kind and generous gesture in funding the loans for these women. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Los Positos Group

texts.en:
Santo Tomás Chichen is a town in the Western Highlands with a population of about 30,000. 

Seven women in the municipality, with the goal of empowering themselves and eliminating poverty, have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Los Pocitos.” Most of the women work in textile production and animal husbandry.

Rosa is a member of the Trust Bank with five years of formal education. She is 24 years of age, with two children. 

Rosa works hard to move ahead and has a sad history. Her mother died when she was a child.  She grew up with her grandmother who, in spite of her advanced age, shared a lot with her. 

Rosa has an animal husbandry business as well as a textile business. She creates traditional colorful blouses and needs a loan to purchase supplies like a large quantity of thread in various colors.

The seven women of the “Los Pocitos” Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings. Some of the topics covered include effective business management practices (business design, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service), hygiene, health, and the use of medicinal plants, as well as empowerment and self-esteem. The combination of the loans and education is what Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus,” and it truly works!

Thank you, Kiva investors, for reading about these women, who would greatly appreciate a loan. Empowered with the loans and education, these women can step into a brighter and more successful future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, like a large quantity of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Esperanza De Chipaca I Group

texts.en:
The thirteen women who form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esperanza de Chipaca I” or “Hope of Chipaca I” look forward to generating additional household income, sending their children to school and boosting their self-esteem. The ladies of this Trust Bank, who live in a rural area of Chichicastenango, Guatemala, work in their various small businesses that include traditional textile production (weaving and embroidery), agriculture (apples and peaches) as well as animal husbandry.

Manuela is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 28 years old, with two children who are four and seven years of age. Her husband is a farmer. Manuela has been a weaver since childhood. After her marriage, she began her animal husbandry business since the couple needed extra income. Manuela is requesting a loan that she is planning to use for the purchase of thread in various colors and other supplies. The end of the year is approaching with many celebrations including graduations, parties and weddings. She wants to have all of her supplies in order and plenty of inventory on hand. Manuela will also use part of her loan to purchase feed for her 10 roosters, 30 chickens and 3 pigs.

On behalf of her friends in the Trust Bank, Manuela appreciates the help of KIVA investors throughout the world in funding loans. With these small loans and education, the women are more prepared to be productive, support their children and create a more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: purchase of thread in various colors and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband buy more raw items for his glass store

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of ten children, Rosario works hard to support her family.  She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconuts.  Rosario is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 46-year-old married woman doing business in the purchase and sale of animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 7 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

Currently, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers, to generate greater revenue in the future

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Jonathan is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruby is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ruby has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Ruby requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.

Ruby has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old, with three children in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Virginia has been in this business for six years now.   In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ferid

texts.en:
Ferid is married and the father of three children between the ages of three months and 16 years old. He has tried several times to change working places in order to give his children whatever they need. He has worked as a baker and now he is working as a taxi driver. 

He had to sell his vehicle and is now requesting a loan of 600 euros in order to purchase a new one. This loan will help him to increase his income and he will not have to ask other people for money, which is very difficult and uncomfortable for him. He is very satisfied with the income and this type of work, and feels secure that he can use this as his main source of income to provide for his family. He has built a large customer base over the last three years he has been in business and knows that he can continue to grow. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi vehicle

loans.name: Kaenghadd Group

texts.en: Joy's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Joy's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Joy is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Joy’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Joy and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Joy's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dongphung Group

texts.en: Xom's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Xom’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Xom is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Xom due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thongwan Group

texts.en: Vade's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in Vade's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Vade is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Vade’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Vade and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Vade's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married. She has two adult daughters and three grandchildren. 

Nadiya has her own business.  She has been selling men's clothes at the central market for 22 years. She has her own trading place. 

Nadiya is an open, kind, and hardworking person. She serves her clients very well.   Nadiya had some financial challenges with the Ukrainian currency devaluation. She and her husband went for work to Israel. Now the financial situation is better, and Nadiya wants to develop her business further.

Nadiya is asking for loan of UAH 10,000 to buy men's sweaters. The loan will help her to increase her assortment and get bigger income.

loans.use: to buy men's sweaters to resell

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Expedito está integrada por 18 mujeres muy emprendedoras de la ciudad de Santaní,  actualmente están en el séptimo ciclo. El grupo es muy unido y solidario, formado en una ciudad bastante alejada de la capital del país, que aun está en crecimiento.
La señora Guisela se dedica a la cría de animales y venta de huevos de su propia producción, comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones pudo salir adelante e ir ayudando a su marido con este ingreso, para poder cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con la cría como lo viene haciendo. Todas están contentas por esta oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
This group is named San Expedito and is made up of 18 very enterprising women from the city of Santaní.  At the present time, they are in their seventh loan cycle. The group is very united and supportive of each other. Their growing city is quite far from the capital of the country.

Senora Guisela makes a living from raising animals and the sale of eggs from her own chickens.
