She states that, thanks to training sessions, she has been able to get ahead and with this income to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy prepared feed for her animals and, in this way, be able to continue raising animals as she has been doing. All of the members are happy with this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy commercial food for her livestock.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un Joven muy Responsable, Respetuoso Humilde. Actualmente vive con sus Padres es un Joven muy conocido en su barrio. Uno de sus Objetivos como Persona es llegar a Culminar sus Estudios Universitarios en ingeniería comercial y llegar a recibirse. 
Su meta es llegar a tener buen Ingreso para ayudar a sus padres en el Hogar y luego como toda persona llegar a independizarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Luis is a very responsible, respectful and humble young man. He currently lives with his parents and is well known in his neighbourhood. One of his personal goals is to complete his university studies in commercial engineering and get his degree.

Luis' aim is to earn a good income in order to help his parents at home, and then, like everybody, to become independent.

He is asking for this loan in order to pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una joven estudiante y también trabaja como vendedora en una casa comercial para poder estudiar y ayudar a su familia.
Está siguiendo la carrera de enfermería es muy dedicada al estudio, una buena persona que desea sobresalir y ser diferente a los demás con sus esfuerzos para alcanzar sus metas. Su sueño es de obtener un título Universitario y ser una profesional competente así poder trabajar en forma independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Juana is a young student who also works as a salesperson at a retail center so she can afford to go to school and help her family. She's working towards a degree in nursing and she's very committed to her education, is a good person and wants to excel and stand out by the effort she puts into reaching her goals. Her dream is to obtain a college degree and be a competent professional so that she can work independently. She's requesting this loan so she'll be able to pay her college tuition and that way continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, vive con su familia, y a la vez que estudia también está trabajando. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder recibirse de Ingeniera Comercial y desarrollarse  como profesional 
El préstamo le ayudará a encaminarse a sus metas,  está agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder cumplir su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Patricia is from the city of San Ignacio. She lives with her family. She works and goes to school. She says that her dream is to be able to receive her Commercial Engineer degree and become a professional.

The loan will help her to reach her goals. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives to be able to fulfill her dream of being somebody in life.

She is asking for this loan to cover the costs of her degree studies.

loans.use: to pay degree school fees

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una joven que esta luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida, en su carrera se esta esforzando bastante, ya que le gustaría poder ser alguien en la vida, una persona de provecho, comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda y que le ha sido muy útil.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Liliana is a young lady fighting to be someone in life. In her degree she is becoming stronger, since she would like to be able to be someone in life - someone useful. She says that her previous loan was a great help to her and that it was very useful.

She is asking for this loan so that she can pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: José Refugio Felix

texts.en:
José is a Mexican small farmer.  He owns one hog, two horses and raises poultry for a living. He also cultivates zucchini and kidney beans for his family's own consumption, and corn, some of which he sells on the local market. He decided to invest in a biodigester to save money, protect the environment and improve his family's health. Indeed, the biodigester will allow him to displace the expensive and non-renewable LP gas he used to buy to heat water, and replace it with the biogas produced through the natural methanisation process of his animals' manure taking place in the biodigester. His wife will not have to walk hours looking for wood in the surrounding mountains anymore, as the biodigester will be connected to her cookstove, allowing her to cook with biogas. José's family's health will improve, as they will not inhale the toxic smoke anymore. The bacteria in the biodigester also produce an organic, nutrient-rich biofertilizer, which José will be able to spread on his fields in order to improve his crops' yield in a natural way and protect the soil. With the savings he will make, José plans to buy more animals to expand his farm, and do small construction works in his house, making it a more comfortable place to live. 
This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en:
Jotham is married and has six children. He is an electrician as well as a pastor. He also does farming with his wife.  They have been farming for 45 years now.  They are currently growing vegetables, bananas, tea, and indigenous trees. He also keeps cattle and fish. 

Jotham lives in Kakamega county, located in western Kenya.  It is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. 

The density of the old-growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. Jotham is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income through the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Jotham's first loan with Honey Care.  He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Jotham's hope for the future is to build a good house, buy a welding machine, and start a business.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Joseph is married and has ten children. He is a mason, while his wife runs a small business of selling fish. They are also farmers. They have been farming for twenty five years now and they are currently growing maize, sorghum, beans and sunflowers.  Joseph is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to improve his house. Joseph's hope for the future is to live a changed life through beekeeping and to convince others to take up beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Michael is married and has nine children. He runs a small business of selling coal and vegetables. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for 15 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, sunflowers, and trees. They also keep poultry. Michael is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is Michael's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in beekeeping. Michael's hope for the future is to be able to provide enough food for his family and to have his children educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Khamfai Group

texts.en:
Bountern's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the villages, including Bountern’s, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Bountern is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Bountern due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works for three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Damas Del Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Damas del barrio san Antonio se encuentra en el ciclo 12 del programa de comités, como así también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, este grupo esta con las expectativas bien claras y precisas de salir adelante como sea motivo por el cual se están esforzando día a día.
Zulma integra este grupo, es una muy buena peluquera, y comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre va a su salon. Ella es una mujer luchadora y muy sacrificada, que se esfuerza por su familia y por sus seres queridos, para poder darles una buena calidad de vida.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “Damas del Barrio San Antonio” (Women of San Antonio Neighborhood) is in its 12th loan cycle with the committee program. In addition, the members are participating in the poverty elimination program. This group has well-defined and precise expectations of how to get ahead because they want to get stronger each day.

Zulma is a member of this group. She is a very successful beautician and says that she has good customers who always come to her salon. Zulma is a determined and self-sacrificing woman who strives on behalf of her family and her loved ones. She wants to provide them a good quality of life.

Today she is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other products that will help her to continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other products for her salon.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona que se esta esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida y también poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus ingresos y sus estudios. comenta que préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para pagar sus costos varios.
Pide hoy un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe y que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Hector is from the city of Pilar. He is striving to be someone in life, but also to be able to help his family through his income and his studies. He says that his previous loan was very useful for covering his various costs.

He is now asking for another loan so that he can pay his university fees. He is grateful for the new opportunity that he is getting and that it will be very useful to him.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 22 años, estudia la carrera de marketing y publicidad está en el tercer año, a la vez que estudia también trabaja para costear sus estudios.
Su meta es terminar la carrera y poder trabajar en su profesión, se ve trabajando en una empresa grande y en un cargo acorde a su profesión. Es una joven muy trabajadora y luchadora en sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Ruth is 22 years old. She is studying for a degree in marketing and advertising. She is in her third year and while going to school she also works in order to cover the cost of her studies.

Her goal is to finish her degree and be able to work in her profession, working in a large company and have responsibilities according to her profession. She is a hardworking young fighter in her studies.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the payment of school fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Joelka Maria

texts.es:
Joelka es caracterizada por sus deseos de superación y por el amor al aprendizaje. Esta joven de 29 años de edad, se siente muy agradecida con las personas que le extendieron la mano en el préstamo anterior, ya que con él pagó su curso de titulación y ahora es egresada de la licenciatura de Administración de Empresas. Además, tiene desde hace cuatro años su negocio de venta de ropa por temporadas. 
Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana, de su padre y de su esposo, quienes no dudan en apoyarla económicamente. En estos momentos solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y para pagar un curso de computación. De esta manera seguirá creciendo intelectual y profesionalmente. De igual forma, el desempeño de Joelka será inigualable, lo que le permitirá obtener mejores condiciones laborales y establecer un negocio propio de excelente calidad.
texts.en: Joelka is known for her desire to improve herself and her love of learning. This young woman is 29 years old, and feels very grateful to the people that lent a hand with the previous loan, since she used it to pay for a degree program and she's now a graduate in Business Administration. Additionally, she has had her seasonal clothing business for four years. She can count on the support of her sister, father, and husband who don't hesitate to help her financially. At this time she's applying for a loan to purchase a computer and to pay for a computer class. This way she'll be able to grow intellectually and professionally. Also, Joelka's performance will be unbeatable, which will allow her to obtain better working conditions and set up an excellent business of her own.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and pay for a computer class.

loans.name: Gladis Abelina

texts.es: Gladis de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, también posee una tienda, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Gladis, 37, lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She works selling clothes with her business which is located in her home.

She also owns a shop and she has many loyal customers due to the quality of the clothes and the good prices. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk so that she can continue selling and so increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, sorghum, sugarcane and sunflower. 

Fredrick is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.  Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in their region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

This is Fredrick's first loan with Honey Care.  He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Fredrick's hope for the future is have his children educated.

Fredrick lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County, which is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers.  Nonetheless, farmers have adapted by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jairo

texts.en:
Jairo lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Jairo is married and has four children. He is a retired plant operator. He is now practicing farming with his wife. They have been farming for 10 years now, and they are currently growing maize, sorghum and beans. Jairo is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide him with income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is Jairo's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family's basic needs. Jairo's hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and produce more honey and to also invest in other businesses.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron lives in Ogongo, Kenya in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing. A few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Hezron is married and has four children. He is a mason, while his wife is a farmer. She has been farming for 10 years now and is currently growing maize, sorghum, beans, onions, groundnuts, and sunflower. Hezron is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Hezron's first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to invest in beekeeping. Hezron's hope for the future is to experience a positive impact in his life through beekeeping and to encourage more youths to undertake beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a widow with three children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for 25 years now.  She is currently growing maize, beans, groundnuts and sunflower. Jeniffer is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Jeniffer's first loan with Honey Care.  She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and invest in her farm. Jeniffer's hope for the future is to live a better life and to have her children educated.

Jeniffer lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County, which is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world.  Many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope.  Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A senhora  Ana de 63 anos é comerciante, casada mae de 8 filhos todos  ja maiores de idade sustenta 3 netos que vive com ela e vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar refrescos, bebidas, feijao, arroz, amendoim para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e fazer dependencias para arrendar reforcando a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao insuficiencia de fundose para superar as dificuldades  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Ana is a 63-year-old vendor. She's married and has eight children, all of whom are already adults. She supports three grandchildren who live with her. She lives in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase refreshments, beverages, beans, rice and peanuts, so she can strengthen her business.
Her projects and dreams are to make her business grow, meet all of her customers' needs, and build rooms for renting out in order to improve her family's income.
She states that the main challenges she has faced are the lack of funds to overcome difficulties. She also states that she uses rotating credit as a way of saving her money, and that she'll apply for more loans so she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beverages, beans, rice, and peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up his tourism workspace.

loans.name: Heilyn

texts.es: heilyn es una madre soltera que lucha por darle el sustento a sus hijos dia a día. Ella tiene un pequeña pulpería en su comunidad con lo que puede sacar apenas lo necesario para dar el alimento a sus hijos. Ella tiene el deseo de poder hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su ingresos, por lo que necesita de un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones para poder comprar los productos necesarios para abastecer su negocio y con esto mejorar los ingresos diarios. Para ella este negocio es una bendición por lo que espera mejorar y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Heilyn is a single mother who works hard to put food on her children's table day after day. She has a small grocery store in the community with which she makes just enough to feed her kids. Her desire is to make her business grow and improve her income, for which she needs a loan of one million and fifty thousand colones to be able to stock her store and thus improve daily income. To her this business is a blessing and she hopes that it gets better and continues to grow.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the grocery store.

loans.name: Milton Geovanny

texts.es: Milton es un joven  de 30 años de edad, el trabaja en una hacienda cuidando ganado desde hace 3 años,  Milton vive solo en una pequeña casa que le presta su patrón, Milton es responsable y le da la mantención a su hijo de 3 años y a la medre de su hijo, el crédito lo necesita para comprar 2 terneros para criarlos en los terreno que le presta su patrón y no le cobra por la hierba, lo que Milton aspira es mejorar su negocio y también comprar más terneros para que sus ingresos sean mayores y así tener su hogar sin necesidades.
texts.en:
Milton is a 30 year old young man. He has been working on a ranch caring for cattle for three years. Milton lives alone in a little house provided by his employer.

Milton is responsible for the maintenance of his 3 year old son and the growth of his son. He needs the loan in order to buy 2 calves for raising them in the field of his employer who does not charge him for the grass. Milton hopes to improve his business and also buy more calves so that his income is higher and thus lack nothing in his household.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina de 53 años de edad,  no estudio, sus padres solo la pusieron a prender los quehaceres del hogar. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura a sembrar maíz y frijoles en su terreno; son padres de cuatro hijos que trabajan y ayudan  para el sostenimiento de su hogar.


Agustina se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,ella tiene ayuda de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos el cual le responden y le dan para la alimentación y otras necesidades de su hogar.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar alambre de puas, madera, grapas, para cercar su terreno, ya que no tiene y lo quiere vender en un futuro también para sembrar palos frutales para que después tenga mejor precio, de esa manera lograra cubrir la necesidad que existe en este momento.

El sueño de Agustina es siempre estar con sus hijos apoyándoles.
texts.en:
Agustina is 53 years old, and never attended school, since her parents only set her to learning how to do housework. Her husband works in agriculture and plants corn and beans on their land; they're the parents of four children who work and help to support the household.

Agustina is a housewife, and she is helped by her spouse and her children who step up and help provide food and other necessities.

She's applying for the loan to purchase barbed wire, wood, and staples to build a fence on their land, since it doesn't have one and she's looking to sell it in the future, and also to plant fruit trees so that the land will be worth more. This will enable her to meet her current needs.

Agustina's dream is to always be with her children and help them.

loans.use: To purchase barbed wire, wood, and staples to build a fence on her land, since she doesn't have one and she's looking to sell it in the future.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 20 years now.  They are currently growing maize, sorghum, beans, and groundnuts. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food and medicine. 

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care.  He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to provide clothing for his family. Joseph's hope for the future is to live in a better house and to buy an ox for ploughing.

Joseph lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County, located at the south-western tip of Kenya.  Its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people; a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, who arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people hold a strong cultural emphasis on education.  School attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Namai Group

texts.en:
Chantha is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of waterborne diseases.

Chantha's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the villages, including Chantha’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income for users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Chantha and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood.

Chantha's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works for three to five years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha Província de Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 1 filho menor de idade que frequenta a Escola, não responsabiliza se por ninguém. 
Trabalha no processamento de água mineral a mais de 9 anos, onde aufere mensalmente um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, blocos, ferro, barrotes e outros que forem necessários. Este é seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.	
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura e dar continuidade com os estudos até ao nível superior
texts.en:
Lalita was born in the Namaacha district of Maputo province in Mozambique. She is 30 years old and is a single mother with one child who is in school. She is not financially responsible for anyone else.

Lalita has worked at a mineral water processing plant for more than nine years, earning a monthly salary that she uses to cover household expenses and also to pay for a home construction project. With this loan she would like to continue with this home construction project by buying materials like blocks, cement, sand, iron and posts, and any other materials she might need. This is her third loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, Lalita would like to buy a vehicle and continue with her education through college.

loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, sand, iron and posts, and any others she might need.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos es un joven emprendedor, tiene un pequeño taller de repuestos y reparación de motocicletas. Con esto ha podido dar el sustento a su familia, sin embargo necesita mejorar su taller y aumentar las ventas para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él necesita de un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones para comprar los repuestos y maquinaria para su taller y así aumentar las ventas. El es un joven con grandes deseos de superarse y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young entrepreneur. He has a small motorcycle repair and spare parts shop. With it he has been able to support his family. Nevertheless he needs to improve his shop and increase sales in order to give his family a better quality of life. 

He needs a loan of 1,050,000 CRC to purchase parts and machinery for his shop and thus increase sales.
 
He is a young man with a great desire to succeed and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: Lazaro Alfredo

texts.es: Lazaro de 29 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio,  vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas en casa propia. El posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, Lazaro solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lazaro, 29, is a very hardworking and responsible person who is fully dedicated to his business. He lives with his wife and their two daughters in their own home. He has owned a fruit and vegetable stall for 7 years, which is located in the municipal market near his home.

Lazaro is asking for a loan in order to buy more fruit and vegetables in bulk. This will mean an increased income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more fruit and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Anita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Anita se encuentra muy feliz de ir poco a poco mejorando las condiciones de su casa. En estos momentos, esta mujer de 45 años de edad, agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron en el préstamo anterior con el cual pudo construir un baño en su cuarto, mejorando las condiciones higiénicas de ella y de su familia. Esta madre soltera es docente y se sabe que la salud higiénica es indispensable en la vida de un ser humano.
Ahora Anita está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar cemento, un inodoro, un lavamanos, tubería, entre otros materiales para construir un nuevo baño en el patio de su casa. Esto le permitirá que sus visitas tengan también un baño, sin necesidad de entrar a su cuarto; además de evitar que su familia completa adquiera enfermedades gastrointestinales. Al final de pagar este crédito, tiene planeado construir más cuartos y la cocina de su casa.
texts.en:
Anita is very happy to be able to improve the conditions of her house little by little.  A woman of 45 years of age, Anita thanks all of the people who helped her on her last loan, with which she was able to build a bathroom in her bedroom, improving the hygienic conditions of herself and her family. This single mother is a teacher and we know that hygiene is indispensable in the life of human beings.

Now Anita is asking for a new loan to buy cement, a toilet, a sink, pipe and other materials to construct another bathroom in the patio of her house. This will allow visitors to have a bathroom, without the necessity of entering her bedroom. In addition it will help her entire family avoid contracting gastrointestinal diseases. After finishing payment of this loan, she plans to build more rooms and a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy cement, a toilet, a sink, pipe and other materials to build a new bathroom.

loans.name: Khambone Group

texts.en:
Nuhak's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Nuhak's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Nuhak is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. Even though some people in the villages, including Nuhak’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income for users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Nuhak and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood.

Nuhak's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works for three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Agar

texts.pt:
A senhora  Agar 30 anos é bombeira,   mae de 2 filhos todos a estudar sustenta 1 sobrinho que  vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, varroes, pedra, para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar a construcao de sua casa e um dia fazer  uma merceiaria na sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro,alem do seu emprego faz negocio por encomendas e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Agar is a 30-year-old gas station worker. She has two children who attend school, and she supports a nephew. She lives in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase cement, sand, rods, and sand so she can continue her construction work.
Her projects and dreams are to finish building her house and someday set up a grocery store at her house.
She states that the main challenges she has faced are financial, and that she uses rotating credit as a way of saving her money, Aside from her job she does business on demand. She also states that she'll apply for more loans so she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rods, and sand.

loans.name: Agostinho

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto Província de Gaza tem 50 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua irmã que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha como motorista a mais de 2 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois na tentativa de terminar a sua obra de residência solícita um empréstimo para adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, pedras e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e iniciar criação de gado
texts.en:
Agostinho was born in Chibuto, in the Gaza province of Mozambique. He is 50 years old and is married with 6 children, 4 of whom are grown and independent. Besides his family, he also helps care for his sister, who lives with him.

Agostinho has worked as a driver for more than two years, earning a monthly salary that he uses to cover household expenses. With this loan he would like to complete a home construction project by buying construction materials like cement, sand, stone, and any others that might be needed. This is his first loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to finish the construction project and start raising cattle.

loans.use: buy construction materials like cement, sand, stone, and any others that might be needed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Kuña Guapa se formo con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de Ciudad del Este, están en su Cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con lo cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
La señora Valentina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que esta en un nivel bajo. Para poder ayudar a la señora ha recibido capacitación de plan de negocios y pasos para presentar la venta.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser: verduras ,aceite, poroto, fideos, arroz, etc.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa was formed with the union of various neighbors and friends from Ciudad del Este.  They are in their 4th loan cycle of the woman committee program. They are all doing the eliminate poverty survey, where they learn of each of their own situation.

Valentina’s survey results showed the poverty level at stage 1 which means she is in a low level. To be able to help her, she received training in business planning and selling presentation steps.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her store, such as, vegetables, oil, beans, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oil, beans, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn by the hundredweight and lime.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es: Willian de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, el vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Willian is 32 years old and has been selling shoes for 4 years. His business is located in a heavily traveled area and therefore he has a lot of customers.

He lives with his wife and two children in a house they own. With his shoe sales he manages to pay his expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase shoes wholesale so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has seven children. She runs a small kiosk, and she is a farmer as well. She has been farming for thirty years now, and she is currently growing maize, sorghum, beans, peas and groundnuts. Her husband is too old to work. 

Rose is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for medicine.  This is Rose's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family's basic needs and to save up for the future. 

Rose's hope for the future is to expand her beekeeping project, encourage the youths to take up beekeeping, and to live a better life.

Rose lives in Kipasi, a small town in Homa Bay County, which is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world.  Many individuals make their living from fishing; a few work in the small but growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope.  Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her rice plantings and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years old and has been working for eight years making and selling tortillas. 

Her business is located in her home and she has many customers, especially her neighbors. 

She lives in her own home with her three children and is asking for a loan in order to buy corn in bulk and lime in order to be able to continue making tortillas and thus be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime

loans.name: Nakhaolom Group

texts.en:
Wias' village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Wias, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Wias is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income for users like Wias due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works for three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, aged 43, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She has an agricultural business in the Philippines, and has been running her business which involves raising pigs for one year now. 

Concepcion has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cresi

texts.en:
Cresi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fish net materials, plywood, and paint for her fishing business.

Cresi has been in this business for five years.  She earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cresi has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish net materials, plywood, and paint

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Lucy has been in this business for 20 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Lucy requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell. In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Houyhae Group

texts.en:
Bounxeang is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of waterborne diseases. Bounxeang's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.

Even though some people in the village, including Bounxeang, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income for users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Bounxeang and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood.

Bounxeang's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works for three to five years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

Maria has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her restaurant

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old and married with nine children, eight of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as coffee, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Mercy has borrowed and paid twenty-five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mercy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as coffee, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém. 
É negociante a mais de 7 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende adquirir bens para sua casa como: sofás e congelador. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Adelia comes from Massinga. province of Inhambane. She's 34 years old and married. She has two underage children, only one of whom attends school. She's not responsible for anybody.
She has been a business owner for over seven years and she earns a profit which she uses for household expenses. With the requested loan she intends to purchase goods for her house such as sofas and a freezer. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to finish building her house and purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her house such as sofas and a freezer.

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, Jose solicita un préstamo para poder comprar  más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 48 years old and lives in a house he owns with his wife. For many years he has had a stand where he sells fruits and vegetables, which is located in the market near his home. Jose is asking for a loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale, as in this way he will be able to have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working mother who makes a living from her own farm where she earns well while her husband works as a merchandiser. Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake. In the end, she will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so she can provide better conditions for her family.

Evelyn started to operate her farm a number of years ago. She works alone from early in the morning when her husband is busy with his work. But they work together more often on weekends. She has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy organic fertilizer to enhance her farm yields. Rest assured Evelyn will have a better future for she is determined to have it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance her farm yields.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en:
Annielyn has been running a general store to make a living. The couple earns a good living from their efforts and investments, their retailing business, and transportation services. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying grocery goods for her retail store.

To expand her business, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods and to finance her video machine for her business expansion.

Her ability to engage in business is now improving, and she is thankful to GDMPC for providing them with investment capital to improve their living.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and to finance her video machine for her business expansion.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has a business retailing grocery goods and a business selling barbecue.. She also cooks additional foodstuffs. 

Her previous loan, used for buying raw ingredients, has been repaid successfully. 

To make improvements, she took a new loan recently to purchase more raw ingredients and new utensils for her store. 

In the future, she wants to expand her business and make it a merchandise grocery store and a more convenience place for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients and new utensils for her store

loans.name: Josselyn Adriana

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Ilusión.
En este lugar vive la señora Josselyn, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 meses de nacida. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Josselyn es una joven madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para ganar lo suyo y ayudar con los gastos que genera la crianza de su pequeña, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, sabanas, cortinas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale a la hora que este desocupada y si hay alguien que le pueda cuidar a su bebe sale con mas tranquilidad, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad con el cual gana sus propios ingresos y le ayuda a su marido con los gastos. 
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones, pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusión meets biweekly in Cadí's parrish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its hardworking people, who are mainly farmers.

This is where Josselyn lives. She is nineteen years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has a three-month-old baby girl and her husband is a driver.

Josselyn is a young mother and wife who likes to work in order to earn what is hers and help with the expenses of raising her daughter. She is in the trade business. She sells clothes, sheets, curtains, and quilts, among other things. She is a door to door sales person and goes out when she is not busy. If there is anybody that can take care of her baby, she goes out with more peace of mind. She also sells in her house where her most known customers come and buy on credit. She then collects her payments every week. She has been doing this for three years. This allows her to make her own money and help her husband with the expenses. 

This loan is to buy sheets, quilts, pants, shirts, blouses and other clothing items. This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, pants, blouses, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rachelle has been in this business for three years now.

Rachelle requested a 11,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional fish net materials, plywood and paint. In the future, Rachelle would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net materials, plywood and paint

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 45 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as sugar, milk, spices, eggs, coffee, etc.

Milagros has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as sugar, milk, spices, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 61 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. Alma has run a general store in the Philippines for the past eight years. 

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида 36 летняя замужняя женщина. Она живет с мужем,мать 3 детей. Умида трудолюбивая и общительная женщина.Ее муж работает в сфере строительство. Но из-за трудностей Умида решила поддержать мужа и начать свой  бизнес.Их семья очень дружная, что и делает Умиду такой амбициозней. Она работает швеей и очень любит свою работу. Она мастер своей работы и клиентов у нее очень много. В этом году она решила сама покупать нужную ткань и основные средства для расширения своего бизнеса путем сшиванием  одежды и продаж для малоимущего слоя населения.Но из-за финансовых трудностей она обратилась в МДО " Арванд" за кредитом.Умида надеется что Арванд сможет ей помочь решить финансовую проблему.Она заинтересована в долгосрочных отношениях с Арванд.
texts.en: Umida is 36 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and she has three children.  She is a hardworking and sociable woman.  Her husband works in construction.  Because of financial difficulties, she has decided to support her husband and start her own business.  Umida's family is very friendly and Umida herself has a lot of ambitions.  She works as a seamstress and likes her job very much.  She runs her own business and has a lot of customers.  This year, Umida has decided to buy the fabrics that she needs by herself, as well as some basic supplies to expand her business, and to do so by sewing and selling some clothes for the poorest local residents.  But because she is experiencing financial difficulties herself, she has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan.  Umida hopes that MDO Arvand will help her solve her financial problems.  She is interested in pursuing a long-term relationship with this organization.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

Nelinda has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Nelinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 56 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 7 filhos maiores de idade apenas 4 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 6 netos que vivem em sua casa.
É avicultora a mais de 8 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Na tentativa de satisfazer os seus clientes, solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo ração, pintos e vitaminas. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende erguer mais Capoeiras.
texts.en:
Celina comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. She's 56 years old and a widow. She has seven adult children, four of whom are in school. She's responsible for her six grandchildren who live with her.
She has been a poultry farmer for over 8 years and she earns a profit which she uses for household expenses. As an attempt to keep her customers satisfied, she requests a loan so she can increase turnover in her chicken raising business by purchasing feed, chicks and vitamins. This is her 8th loan with Hluvuku. In the future she intends to build more coops.

loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks and vitamins.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Morrombene Província de Inhambane, tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente na sua casa própria, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola. Não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É modista a mais de 5 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 7ª empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende garantir o ensino dos seus filhos e dar continuidade a sua obra.
texts.en:
Judite comes from Morrombene, province of Inhambane. She's 38 years old and married, and lives in a house that she owns. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She's not responsible for anyone.
She has been a dressmaker for over 5 years and earns a profit which she uses for household expenses. With the requested loan she intends to continue building her house by purchasing construction supplies such as sand, cement, and other items that are needed. This is her 7th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to provide an education for her children and continue the construction work.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, and other items that are needed.

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Sukhbaatar, 58 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a crane operator at a building company since 2012. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. Their daughter lives on her own in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy an electric car which will be used for taxi service as an extra income generator during his day off. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia  Monica se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante , el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Monica continues with her handcrafts business. She sells knitted items, sweaters, blankets, and woven items. She wants to move ahead through this business. Her dream is to expand the business selling knitted and woven items. She is asking for the loan in order to buy knitted items, sweaters, and woven items.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy knitted items, sweaters, and woven items

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de obras artesanales como las que muestra en la fotografía desde hace 20 años, se ha hecho de mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, Carlos está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar arcilla, pintura y barniz, y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos, 52 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He has made and sold handcraft works such as those seen in the photograph for 20 years. He has built up a large clientele because of the quality of his work. Carlos is asking Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy clay, paint, and varnish, and thus be able to continue with his work in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint, and varnish

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: To earn a living, Jennifer has been helping her husband in operating their motorcycle transportation services. Her previous loan that was used for renewal of their registration of the motorcycle was successfully repaid. To make their services safer, she has taken out a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy new tires, front cover, hydraulic piston, and other motor and engine parts to repair and maintain their motorcycle. Jennifer is hopeful of expanding their business in order to provide a better education for their five children.

loans.use: to buy new tires, front cover, hydraulic piston, and other motor and engine parts to repair and maintain their motorcycle

loans.name: Lanie Rose

texts.en:
Lanie Rose, married with three children, has been running a transportation-service business to make a living. Her husband is a farmer and at the same time, operates their services. Her previous loan used for maintenance and repairs for her motorcycle has been repaid successfully. She had to buy new spare parts to make her services more secure to her customers. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase motorcycle body parts, engine parts and machinery for her vehicle. She has a future plan of renovating her house to have a more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle body parts, engine parts and machinery for her vehicle

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sheryl is 27 years old, and three children are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sheryl requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Sheryl has been in this business for three years. In the future, Sheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Watti

texts.en:
Watti works hard to support her family. Watti is married and has a fruit-and-vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Watti has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Watti would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Angelita is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods, meat, etc., for her food-vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods, meat, etc., for her food vending

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Berlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen products.  Berlinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, peanuts, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Berlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 39 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Чынары- неоконченное высшее образование, работает ткачихой в швейном цехе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы и 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на косметический  ремонт дома. Она приобретет ламинат, обои, краску. После ремонта Чынара с семьей смогут переехать в собственный дом, на сегодняшний день в нем нет условий для жизни и приходится жить со свекром. Доходы от бизнеса и зарплату Чынара планирует откладывать на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Chynara is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She did not finish her higher education.  She works as a weaver in a sewing shop.  To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is also involved in animal husbandry.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns four cows and five sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to renovate her house.  She will use this loan to purchase some laminate, wall paper and paints.  Once she finishes renovating her house, she and her family will be able to move back into their home.  Right now, they cannot live in it and the family has to live with in-laws.  Chynara is planning to use the earnings from her business, as well as her income, to take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase laminate, wallpapers and paints in order to repair her house and be able to move back in it.

loans.name: Tuongozane A Group

texts.fr: Kurasa est une commerçante, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, présidente de la banque villageoise «Tuongozane A», âgée de 37 ans, mariée à un pasteur et mère de 6 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 19 ans. Elle installe sa marchandise au marché centrale de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des casseroles, assiettes, verres, couteaux, fourchettes, etc. Ainsi, elle compte renforcer ses activites, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kurasa is a merchant, a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, and the president of the 'banc villageois' named “Tuongozane A”. Married to a pastor, she is 37 years old and the mother of six children, who are all in school. This client has been a vendor of kitchen utensils for nineteen years. She sets up her merchandise at the town’s central market. She started her business with funds from her husband. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase pots, pans, plates, glasses, knives, forks, etc. Thus, she expects to bolster her business and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase pots, pans, plates, glasses, knives, forks, etc.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is married and has one child. She lives in Ozamiz City with her family.

Jeane has been providing transportation services for more than two years to local community members to earn a living.

Aside from this, her husband is now applying to work abroad to have more income for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to pay for agency services and to buy supplies to extend the garage at her house for the vehicle.

In the future, Jeane hopes to see her child's success and to have more vehicles to expand her transportation business.

loans.use: to pay for agency services and to buy supplies to extend the garage at her house for the vehicle

loans.name: Agostinho

texts.pt:
Nasceu Xai-Xai Província de Gaza tem 45 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha numa quinta como jardineiro a mais de 4 anos onde aufere um valor mensal que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, blocos e pedrinhas. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e tirar carta de condução.
texts.en:
Agostinho comes from Xai-Xai, province of Gaza. He's 45 years old and married. He has six children, four of whom are adults, and all of them are in school. He's not responsible for anybody.
He has worked on a farm as a gardener for over 4 years and earns a monthly income which he uses for household expenses. With the requested amount he intends to continue building his house by purchasing construction supplies such as sand, cement, bricks and gravel. This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to finish building his house and get his driver's license.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, bricks and gravel.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto has been farming for over 12 years and is able to provide for his family's basic needs. He plants and harvests corn to sell in the local community to earn a living. His previous loan used to fertilize his farm has been repaid. Recently, he requested a new loan to purchase new seedlings and planting materials, such as organic fertilizers, to restore farm nutrients to increase productivity. He would like to earn more income in order to renovate his family home to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new seedlings and planting materials, such as organic fertilizers, to restore farm nutrients to increase productivity.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to provide her family’s daily needs and pay their expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carmelita hopes to expand her variety store and become a grocery store someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.  Elena is borrowing PHP28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Irma Abigail

texts.es:
Irma de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado. Su esposo se dedica a jornalero y son padres de tres hijos; dos viven en estados unidos y el ultimo esta con ellos.


Irma se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ya que lo tiene en su casa y les dedica mucho tiempo, antes el negocio era de venta de tamales y pan, pero ahora que sus hijos están en estados unidos ya le ayudan mas.

 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar otros cerdos y concentrados para que se engorden y pueda venderlos a un buen precio. De esa manera, mejorara su calidad de vida y los ingresos serán mejores. 

El sueño de Irma es tener una granja de pollos de engorde y tener una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y seguir trabajando para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Irma, 45 years old, studied until 4th grade. Her husband is a day laborer and they are the parents of three children. Two live in the United States and the last one is with them.

Irma raises pigs, since she has them in her house, and she spends a lot of time on them. Before the business was selling tamales and bread, but now that her children are in the United States they help her more.

The loan she is requesting is to buy other pigs and feed so they fatten up and she can sell them at a good price. In this way, she will improve her quality of life and have a better income.

Irma's dream is to have a farm with broiler chickens and to have a store selling staple products, and to continue working in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy other pigs and feed so that they fatten up and she can sell them at a good price

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 48 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 4 filhas maiores de idade, apenas 3 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém. 
Trabalha na empresa como segurança a mais de 2 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos como arroz, açúcar e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura para o transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Armando comes from Maputo. He's 48 years old and officially married. He has four adult daughters, three of whom are in school. He's not responsible for anybody.
He has worked as a security guard for a company for over two years and earns an income which he uses for household expenses. With the requested loan he intends to stock his business by purchasing products such as rice, sugar and other items that are needed. This is his 8th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to buy a vehicle in order to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar and other items that are needed.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en: Jackielyn is married with one child. She runs a general store which sells goods in her village to make a living.
