She has been in this business for over three years and earns a good income to support her family. To increase her sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods, such as rice and feed, to sell in her store. She hopes to earn more income to expand her business and ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods, such as rice and feed, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jirehlyn

texts.en:
Jirehlyn is 43 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Jirehlyn has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen products and rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Tuongozane B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nzambi est commerçante, membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Tuongozane B», âgée de 60 ans, mariée à un chômeur, mère de 7 enfants dont 4 ont terminés leurs études et 3 sont mariés. La cliente est vendeuse des épices. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de ses amies. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter d'ails, oignons, tomates, kokoliko, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire et augmenter son capital. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Nzambi, is a merchant and a member of the business collective “Tuongozane B”. Married to an unemployed man, she is 60 years old and the mother of seven children, of whom four have finished their studies, and three are married. This client is vendor of grocery items. She displays her merchandise at the town market. She started her business with funds from her friends. She has been in this business for twenty years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase some garlic, onions, tomatoes, kokoliko [possibly a type of squash or its seeds], etc. Thus, she would like to build [a house] and increase her capital. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase garlic, onions, tomatoes, kokoliko, etc.

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad,  solo estudio hasta 2º grado,esta casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar sus hijos estudian bachillerato,solo él sostiene el hogar.


Él se dedica a la construcción y cuando viene la época de lluvia trabaja en la siembra de maíz,los trabajos los aprendió de su padre y también por la necesidad de mantener a su familia y darles educación.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprarle a su hija que se graduá de bachiller el vestido y zapatos y otros gastos adicionales que tendrá. De esa forma, lograra cubrir la necesidad que existe en este momento.

El objetivo de  José es seguir trabajando con CREDICAMPO y dales siempre la mejor educación a sus hijos y así en el futuro ellos trabajen y se ganen la vida ellos solos.
texts.en:
Jose is 52 years old. He only studied through 2nd grade. He is married, and his wife carries out household chores. His children are in high school. He alone sustains the household.

He makes a living in construction, and during the season of rain, he works sowing corn. He learned these jobs from his father and as a result of the need to support his family and give them an education.

He is requesting a loan to buy a dress and shoes for his daughter, who is graduating from high school, and to cover other additional expenses that she has. In this way, he will be able to meet the need that exists at this time.

Jose's goal is to continue working with CrediCampo in order to always give his children the best education so that in the future they can work and earn a living themselves.

loans.use: to buy a dress and shoes for his daughter, who is graduating from high school, and to cover other additional expenses that she has.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Sunly

texts.en: Sunly is a 44-year-old, widowed mother with five children who lives in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Two of her children are students, one rents a small stall at a market selling and repairing mobile phones, and two others are garment-factory workers. Three of them can earn approximately $16 per day. Since the market stall owner is going to stop renting to her son, Sunly would like to request a loan for her son to buy wood and zinc sheets to build a new stall in front of her house to sell and repair phones. This loan will help her son have a proper stall and earn income for the whole family. Sunly hopes to build a bigger house surrounded by fences and help her children finish high school.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc sheets to build a new stall in front of her house to sell and repair phones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es: Juan tiene 58 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 14 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 58 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. For 14 years, he has owned a small store which is located in his home. He has many customers due to his good prices and the kindness he shows when making sales. He is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, sodas, candy, pastries, etc, so that he will have better profits and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, sodas, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita and her husband operate their own coconut farm to earn a living. For over fourteen years in farming, it was doing well and it gives a better income in return. To restore farm nutrients, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional organic fertilizer and for farm maintenance costs to have a more productive harvest. She wants to have a better source of income through farming in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer and for farm maintenance costs to have a more productive harvest

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, chips, etc.

Nilda has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as thread, fabrics, needles, etc., for her tailoring business. Elma successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to build her business further. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, such as thread, fabrics, needles, etc., for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Josephine is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Al ver que su trabajo estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 

Juan se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. 

Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros, para la fabricación de grandes pedidos de sus clientes. 

Aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales. 

Además, espera que el negocio le genere ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan has been a carpenter for most of his life. At a very early age, he began working as an employee in some carpentry workshops and cabinet makers where he learned this trade. 
On seeing that his work was very poorly paid, he decided to work for himself and to start his own carpentry workshop where, thanks to the good quality of his work, he has had many customers. 
Juan is married and is the father of 3 children, to whom he has always wanted to offer a better quality of life and better opportunities to get ahead. 
Because he hasn't had enough capital, he has had to turn down some orders from his customers as he hasn't been able to buy the raw materials. 
With the goal of improving this situation, he hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy raw materials like wood, glue, nails, and others to make the big orders his customers place.  
He hopes that the loan will enable him to fill these orders without affecting his monthly income. 
In addition, he hopes that the business will generate income so that he can offer his wife and 3 children a better quality of life and better opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, glue, nails, and others.

loans.name: Jenifer Ivonne

texts.es:
Jenifer es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, desea salir adelante con su negocio. 

Desde hace más de 1 año inicio un negocio con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio, el negocio se trata de una miscelánea la cual inicio por gusto y por vocación de servicio.

Una de las principales dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la competencia existente en su sector.

Pide un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de productos como papel de regalo, útiles escolares, entre otros; con estos elementos espera mejorar su inventario y aumentar sus ventas de una manera muy sustancial.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprar su casa propia y poco a poco podría lograrlo con tu ayuda.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Jenifer!
texts.en:
Jenifer is an enterprising woman and very hardworking. She wants to be successful in her business.
More than a year ago she started a business with great effort and sacrifice. The business is a gift and stationary store that she started with pleasure and due to a vocation for service. 
One of the greatest difficulties that she has faced is the competition in this market.
She is requesting some economic assistance to buy products such as gift wrap, school supplies, and others. With these items, she hopes to improve her inventory and substantially increase her sales.
Her greatest dream is to be able to buy her own home. With your help, she will be able to reach this goal little by little.
With the loan that you make today, you could improve Jenifer's business and life!

loans.use: to buy prodcuts like girt wrap, school supplies, and others.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy nail polish, pushers and other materials needed for her manicure and pedicure service business. Joy has been in this business for 32 years. Joy earns more income from fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, pushers and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi Group

texts.fr: Anastasie est une commerçante, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Umoja Kibabi», âgée de 34 ans, mariée à un agent d’une Brasserie et mère de 4 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers plastics depuis 5 ans. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une gallérie de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 36 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle compte scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Anastasie is a merchant, a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, and the treasurer of the 'banc villageois' named “Umoja Kibabi”. Married to brewery representative, she is 34 years old and the mother of four children, who are all in school. This client has been a vendor of plastic footwear for five years. She sets ups her merchandise at a shopping center in town. She started her business with funds from her husband. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 36 pairs of shoes. Thus, she expects to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 36 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes au marché depuis 2002 Kokoé sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son commerce et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Âgée de 34ans, elle a 03 enfants en charge.
texts.en: A retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) at the market since 2002, Kokoé is requesting an initial loan to purchase some merchandise. The profit will enable her to expand her commerce and to meet the needs of her family. She is 34 years old and has three children to support.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: Tété Dzinedzo un jeune de 33ans a pour femme un caissier. Ils ont en charge 01 enfant de 04ans. Il est informaticien de profession et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des matériels informatiques. Il espère agrandir dans son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Tété Dzinedzo, a young man, 33 years old, is married to a cashier. They support a 4-year-old child. Tété is a software engineer by profession and is requesting a new loan to purchase computer equipment and supplies. He hopes to expand his business and to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment and supplies

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. Son activité se déroule à domicile et elle fait ses approvisionnements au Grand Marché de Lomé. Pour agrandir son activité et mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait un troisième crédit à WAGES. Akouvi âgée de 58ans à 02 enfants en charge.
texts.en: Akouvi is a grocery retailer. Her business operates out of her home. She stocks up at the Grand Market of Lomé. To expand her business and to respond better to the needs of her customers, she is taking out her third loan at WAGES. Akouvi is 58 years old and has two children to support.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Leah is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Raúl es un mecánico de bicicletas muy experimentado. 

Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de un amigo quien le enseñó del negocio.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas para las bicicletas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen las bicicletas para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas de mano que le hacen falta, de este modo podría mejorar su servicio, mejorar sus ventas, y atraer más clientes gracias a la eficiencia con la que podría trabajar.

Con tu ayuda Raúl podrá salir adelante en su taller!
texts.en:
Señor Raúl is a very experienced bicycle mechanic.

He has acquired a great deal of skill through a friend who taught him the business.

In addition to his work as a mechanic, he also offers different types of spare bicycle parts in various brands.

He is a very hardworking and honorable man who knows the significance that bicycles have for their owners and that's why he always tries to offer excellent, good-quality service in an efficient manner.

He is requesting a loan to buy some hand tools that he needs in order to be able to improve his service, improve his sales, and attract more customers thanks to the efficiency with which he would be able to work.

With your help, Raúl will be able to make progress with his workshop!

loans.use: to buy some hand tools that he needs for his bicycle repair business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna has been helping her husband manage their own corn farm. The couple also have a manufacturing business, making barbecue sticks out of bamboo and selling them in town. Her previous loan was used for farming has been repaid successfully. To make her farm more productive, she will buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. She hopes to generate additional income in order to renovate their house for a better living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Farijika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahani est commerçante, présidente du collectif d’affaires «Farijika», âgée de 48 ans, mariée à un chômeur, mère de 12 enfants dont 6 étudient et 6 sont mariés. La cliente est vendeuse des braises. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du centre commercial de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Il y a 32 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 25 sacs de braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Bahani, is a merchant and the president of the business collective “Farijika”. Married to an unemployed man, she is 48 years old and the mother of twelve children, of whom six are students, and six are married. This client is a vendor of charcoal. She displays he merchandise at a warehouse in the town’s commercial center. She started her business with funds from her husband. She has been in this business for 32 years.

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal. Thus, she would like to provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 31 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Fe has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thania Carolina

texts.es: Thania tiene es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad con un grado de educación cursado de primaria completa, quien es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 2 hijos. En compañía de su esposo se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz lo cual es muy beneficioso dando el respectivo cuidado y atención que este necesita. Como medio de ingreso extra el esposo tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitacion en la cual únicamente ellos habitan. Su experiencia en la siembra de maíz y frijol es mucha ya que aprendió esta de sus padres hace muchos años adquiriendo la propiedad que hoy en día trabajan junto a su esposo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio una parte de la misma y la otra gracias a una herencia por parte de los papas de su esposo la cual está ubicada a una distancia de cincuenta metros de su casa de habitacion a la cual fácilmente pueden desplazarse para dar el cuidado y mantenimiento que sus cultivos necesitan. Sus planes y sueños es poder seguir comprando más tierra para ampliar sus cultivos y en algún momento dado poder hacer de su producto una marca para poder exportar su producto y comercializarlo de una mejor manera, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que puedan ser personas preparadas académicamente y puedan salir adelante. Thania actualmente solicita ser apoyada económicamente para compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, insecticidas y otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y obtener una excelente cosecha
texts.en:
Thania is a 23-year-old young woman who completed primary school. She is married and has two children from her marriage. Together with her husband she makes a living by planting beans and corn, which is very profitable given the care and attention it needs. As an extra means of income, her husband has a metallic structures workshop that is located in their single-family home. She has a lot of experience with planting corn and beans as she learned it from her parents many years ago. She acquired the property she is currently working on along with her husband, with a lot of effort and sacrifice and also thanks to an inheritance from her husband's parents. It is located about fifty meters from their home, so they can easily give their crops the care and maintenance they need. 

Her plans and dreams are to be able to keep buying more land to expand their crops and to make their product into a brand at some point so they can export and market it better. She also wants to support her children in their studies so that they can be people who are academically well-prepared and able to get ahead. Thania is currently asking for financial support to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, insecticides and other items to maintain her crops and obtain an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her corn and bean crops
